Reviews.Title: “Great hotel concept but forgets about the guests”
Reviews.Author: neildj1
Reviews.Content: When we visited we arrived late in the evening + were given the wrong room - a double instead or a twin. We were then told that this was what we had reserved despite me showing the reservation confirmation which clearly stated "twin". I spoke English initially as this is how they greated us + my friend does not speak Spanish. I speak Spanish fluently. One receptionist spoke quite rudely about us in Spanish and was surprised when I then responded in Spanish. We were upgraded for one night and then given the correct room the next day. However, this initial experience really soured the experience. The bathrooms have a transparent shower room + when staying with a friend this is awkward. I was told that this is the "concept" of the hotel. Be aware of this! This is a great hotel, really, but the treatment of us was so poor + I don't think the "concept" is great for friends travelling together. There are other great hotels in Barcelona + next time I will go for one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: GavClark
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel can see why it won the trendiest hotel of the year 2012. It is definatly the trendiest hotel i have ever stayed in. With modern art throughout the whole hotel. The 360 bar on the roof is fantastic being able to see out iver the whole city with binoculars to aid you also. The roof has a pool not very big could probably fit 6 people maximum however you dont go to barcelona to swim. The staff speak fluent english and are very helpful also.The hotel is located not far from the ramblas(walking distance) and is near to most central attractions in Barcelona. If your going for the football the new camp is sitauated about 25 minutes away

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on surprise 40th trip”
Reviews.Author: MJH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for last few days. Really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is chic and minimalist, if youre looking for opulence - then this place isn't probably for you. Rooms are quite small and designed on almost a capsule basis. Bed is large and comfortable Much of the hotel is dark in colour and low lit - which some might find oppressive. Light in the rooms is not helped by the fact that the whole outside of the hotel is clad in a mesh brie soleil - felt a bit like being in guantanamo bay on occasion! Food and cocktails are outstanding, had a veal burger and a beer on the roof terrace yesterday and it was awesome. Breakfast is standard fayre. There is no pool, just a small (but nice) plunge pool on roof deck. There is a gym - but, as is often the case with capsule type hotels it felt a bit of an afterthought - reasonably equipped though One thing to note and I see other people make reference to it, is that el Raval is a tough neighbourhood - fine in the day, but you needed your wits about doubt night with gangs of lads on corners. We were in a group and were fine - I'm not sure is walk around if I were a solo female. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend as a mid-range designer break destination

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel in a non-tourist area”
Reviews.Author: brd_london
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely high class and luxurious hotel in an ultra modern style. Probably the most interesting and well appointed room that I've ever stayed in, but not in the most relaxed area of Barcelona. Stayed in the junior suite - fantastic room with stunning views. Staff were generally very attentive. Breakfast was plentiful but a little chaotic. Mini-bar was well stocked and the ambiance in the bar was great. Don't be put off by the area. Certainly not the nicest part of Barcelona, but if you keep your wits about you you'll be fine. Just 5 minutes from Ramblas, but Raval does have a reputation for being rough (although we saw no trouble at all in this area).

Reviews.Title: “Modern Magnificance”
Reviews.Author: Matty H
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful short week in Hotel Barcelo Raval! Wish we had stayed longer. I know I am only just posting this this review, but I actually went to Barcelo Raval in August 2011 -TripAdvisor said error when I tried to review it straight after I got back from Barcelona! We got a really good deal on Expedia a couple of months before we went, which I have since found out saved us at least £200 over the asking price on the hotel's own website (I think we must have been fortunate.) I could spend hours writing about the hotel and the surrounding area, but instead I will just list the best bits to save everyone time and effort! THE BEST BITS: - Interior/Decor: The hotel is very contemporary and modern from top to bottom. I absolutely loved it. The room was equally modern with a rainfall shower, minimalistic design and stylish lighting with a Nespresso machine too. - Rooftop Pool/Bar: The roof terrace is one of the highlights of this hotel. You can walk all the way round and see some amazing views, including the sea, the business district and older parts of the city. The pool is purely for dipping to cool down, and it is perfect for that. The bar does amazing cocktails for 10 euros. Wine is approx. 7 euros (I think) and Peroni is 5. It's worth it though...plus you get free nibbles! - Location: The closest beach is less than half an hour's walk from the hotel, or you can get the metro to the further away beaches. Las Ramblas is literally 5 minutes away, however we couldn't see what the fuss was about as all we saw was standard Tapas bars and cheap gift shops all along the strip!! We preferred the square that the Hotel itself is on, it has at least 3 bars, 2 restaurants and a supermarket 2 mins down the road. I honestly can't think of many bad points about the area of the hotel. If I was being picky, the breakfast prices are high and so we never ate it at the hotel (15+euros PP I think). I love to keep fit and although there is a gym on the lower ground floor, it is very limited. However you don't go on holiday to work out!! and the lower ground floor itself is very nice. For anyone going to Barca I would highly recommend Barcelo Raval. The location is ideal for seeing all the major attractions and for the amazing beaches, and the hotel itself impressed in every quantifiable and qualitative way concievable. Try and look on independent sites (Expedia, Late Rooms etc.) for better offers than the hotel's own site. PS my photos are too big to upload, which is a shame because they show how beautiful the hotel is!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Andris M
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife pent 2 nights in this hotel. Hotel has good location in the Ramblas (centre of Barcelona). This is designed hotel. Rooms are clean and interesting designed. Perfect bedlinen. From the hotel roof is a perfect view to Barcelona. In general hotel is great. Minus just - nothing to do in bar ("cold"atmosphere"). Other things are ok!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Area... Honestly”
Reviews.Author: psone
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is modern, clean and stylish and the exterior is bright, open and clean. We arrived at the taxi rank outside and walked in to subdued lighting and some groovy sounds in the bar. Check-in was a breeze - all details were exactly as booked. Rather slow elevators took us up to our 10th-floor suite which was interestingly beautiful, with knock-out panoramic views across the city. The over-stocked minibar and oh-so comfy bed left us reluctant to leave the room, at all. Service throughout the hotel was good, though the bar staff could be a little more on-the-ball. Breakfast is good but overpriced, and was slightly chaotic on one morning since the Easter crowds had descended. Almost as if dropped in from space, this hotel is a little at odds with the surrounding area. Out front is a tree-lined boulevard which is great for a wander. The surrounding streets are a different story though and I can see why some people are intimidaed. As said by others I believe there is no more risk in walking around here than anywhere else in the city (in fact, we saw a fake-tourist-police-gun incident in a much "nicer" area but nothing near the hotel). If you stay here and really don't want to venture out, I heartily recommend tapas at Baraval which is literally just across the road and would suit many more budgets than eating-in.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD & BAD”
Reviews.Author: linda e
Reviews.Content: Firstly I will deal with the good and then the bad. The rooms were comfortable, extremely comfortable beds with plenty of pillows. The whole Hotel was clean and modern, the staff were friendly and the Restaurant gave me tea bags and extra milk each evening (a plus for me). Everyone mentions the Restaurant is expensive ALL Hotels are expensive, but not ALL Hotels have superb food, this one did, the evening meals were exceptional, I did think the breakfast was overpriced BUT as there was a lot of choice if you were to have everything, then it was good value, not everyone is able to eat everything that is on offer and I think that is where the problem is, but I would admit that I have had far better breakfasts for a lot less money. THE BAD: I booked the Hotel before I knew it was in a bad area as far as safety is concerned, so I kept in the Hotel the whole time apart from using a taxi to get to and fro my Business during my stay. On the times I was in the Hotel I felt that I was a prisoner within the Hotel. I had been informed it was in a bad area and that is when I read some reviews, apparently on one review the couple had been warned about going out and to keep to main roads. The Hotel knew that I was a lady on my own yet not one person warned me not to go out on my own at night, neither did they tell me about keeping to main roads. Had I not known I would have ventured out to another venue for a meal for a change, this I was afraid to do. A young couple I met went out and got mugged just around the corner from the Hotel and no-body seemed interested in this, maybe because it happens so frequently, as this couple suggested, maybe they should be interested as this will seriously put people off visiting this Hotel. The lighting in the room could have been a lot better and the lighting in the Restaurant could have been brighter in some places, it was dim almost everywhere, the rooms are also noisy. I doubt if I will go back as would never feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and funky...eating out expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: holidaybugLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a hip hotel for couples and friends who like a chilled out vibe in cool contemporary surroundings. If you are from an inner city area the location will not phase you, it is perfectly safe and overlooks a tree lined pedestrian area where there is a market for tourists selling handmade bag etc. Yes you will see small groups of men talking outside some of the small shops, the same as you see groups of men smoking and talking in Morocco, Turkey and Tunisia etc., nothing to be alarmed about. We walked down any of the three streets to get to the Ramblas, and found no hostility at all...the streets are packed with tourists! If you want a 10minute walk to the Port Vell, turn left outside the hotel and avoid the jostling down the Ramblas.The Boqueria market is great for a fresh juice or just to look at the impressive fish and ham stalls.It is just off the Ramblas. We took the bus tour but were not impressed as we were in a leisurely mood, my partner planned to get off at the football stadium but there were a lot of crowds and it cost 22 euros for entry. Overall we were suprised and somewhat unprepared for the cost of eating out.....on average 60 euros for lunch or dinner in a mid range restaurant, no starter or dessert and one drink each! We headed down to Port Olypmic and had a fab seafood meal at "Salamanca" which included free olives and breads and free cake and liquors afterwards....huge portions, monkfish and prawns to die for! Definitely good value compared to the restaurants on and around the Ramblas. Even the Tapas bars are expensive compared to London!? Another great restaurant is "Marmalade" for handmade steak burgers and cava cocktails, they also do a nice" recovery brunch". Make sure you take a drink(buy a bottle form one of the little ethnic shops outside the hotel and down Hospital street ) up to the roof terrace late afternoon and catch some rays, listening to the jazzy Motown music playing up there. Sagrada Familial is under a lot of construction, but we enjoyed Guell Park...take the metro for 3 euros(6 stops) to Vallcarca for amazing views and we also liked the Guell Place, just off the Ramblas. Great brekkie at the hotel and reception staff are super friendly and helpful, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: groovyson
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Barcelona staying in two Barcelo hotels. This was the second hotel and we were very doubtful about staying there after reading some of the reviews. However we had a great stay and would recommend it highly. We found the hotel staff absolutely excellent. Superb command of English, helpful and willing to do their utmost to make us feel special. They presented us with a voucher for a free glass of Cava as a welcome gesture. We departed late afternoon and our luggage was stored efficiently and loaded into a taxi for us. The hotel is decorated in an unusual way however the rooms are very clean, well equipped and the view from our 10th floor room was only slightly spoiled by the mesh on the window. The views from the 360 rooftop terrace were amazing. Breakfast is very good again. Wide choice of bread, pastries and cakes. continental meats and cheeses. Excellent selection of fruit, juices and milkshakes. Good pork sausages and roasted vegetables.The coffee was very good. The only drawback was on the 2nd morning when we were later down to breakfast and it was quite crowded - but it was Easter! Evening Tapas in the restaurant was very good. Not the cheapest but beautifully presented and delicious. On the negative, yes the hotel is in a dodgy area (although very close to La Rambla- so convenient) however we didn't feel terribly unsafe at any time during our visit while walking around during the days. One eve we returned late and chose to take a taxi that dropped us to the door where the very pleasant security man was waiting to greet guests. The area is reflected in the room prices as this is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crime in Raval area”
Reviews.Author: Barbara G
Reviews.Content: Sad to have to write such a review but need to warn future tourists about staying here. We have stayed twice in this hotel and have found it comfortable and welcoming. The trouble is, it is a top end hotel in a very bad area. Glad to return home yesterday, having been mugged on the way back from restaurant one evening this week. The adjacent streets have definitely worsened. A gang of about seven or eight surrounded us, pushing and shoving, asking us "friendly" questions. Our son, the most threatening for them I suppose, was surrounded while they took my husband's wallet. He had been walking at the back of the group. The wallet had been in a secure pocket but they still took it and he had no sensation of them doing so. I have always been an Hispanophile, loving the country, culture, language and specifically the city of Barcelona but now feel disillusioned and vulnerable. It was not just a chance pickpocketing. This group had obviously singled us out. Yes, we will learn from it but, even so, we are seasoned travellers and had deliberately avoided the smaller alleyways. However, they were very slick. Just a few minutes after it happened, my son was approached again in a similar way! Got the feeling this time that the people in this area definitely did not like us and did not want us there. I spoke to police who drove by and again the next day at the police station but they did not really want to know. So, if you are staying at this hotel, pay extra for a taxi to and from when you go out at night. Despite putting a brave face on it, this type of incident really does spoil your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlittergirl
Reviews.Content: Big black statues, over-sized lampshades and funky decor. Not really my style but bed was large and comfortable and room very clean. Semi-open plan layout. Great view from 10th floor. Small gym but no pool (weird bit of water on roof terrace labelled as pool but more like small water feature!). Breakfast ok but nothing special. Central location easy to walk to Ramblas, Montjuic and Barceloneta from. Slightly dodgy area so take care. We paid 2 nights with tesco vouchers and for a third ourselves so good value but wouldn't have booked it at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service but odd area”
Reviews.Author: Nics169
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the service at this hotel, albeit a little slow in the bar. Rooms are nice, well equipped but decor is very dark everywhere which doesn't really help the overall feeling being a little claustrophobic. The entire hotel is encased in metal gridding, so all views from windows are restricted by this as you look out through a mesh. There are however, good all round views from the roof terrace, but this in reality, is much smaller than photos would suggest (they must have had them taken by a good estate agent!). The roof "pool" is nothing more than a large hot tub that isn't hot, there are tables and chairs to sit and admire the view, but these obstruct the way round when people are sat at them, and to be honest, you can't see much sitting down anyhow as the sides to the roof terrace are about 4 feet high. Stairwells are very dark indeed, so use with caution or wait for the slow lifts to arrive (only 1 of 3 go to the roof so it can be quite a wait), corridors very dark and the room lighting too. There is no privacy in the open plan shower, particularly with the mirrored doors too, so only share with someone you know well! Happy to report there is a sliding door to the loo! Not a great deal of wardrobe space if you're staying more than a couple of days but the beds are very comfortable indeed. Overall a decent contemporary hotel, a little bit weird in it's choice of dark decor everywhere, and more than a little bit odd given the location. The best way to describe this hotel is it's like being inside an alien spaceship that has crash landed in a ghetto. I know others say the area is no so bad, but the appearance is dreadful, grafitti everywhere and washing hanging over every balcony, lots of dodgy looking characters hanging around and doesn't feel safe - regardless of whether it actually is safe or not, it doesn't look safe or feel safe. An odd experience indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Dark and badly designed”
Reviews.Author: tmcdonnaugh
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dark with inadequate lighting. There were no windows and it felt like being in a cage. The rooms were small and had no privacy for the shower, they are also badly designed. Maybe ok for one person. Oh and the "swimming pool" is a puddle and they should advertise it as such.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay...no problems for us!”
Reviews.Author: Hols3
Reviews.Content: I had used my Tesco vouchers for the Barcelo. We are fairly well travelled and I would be very fussy about where I stay.. both standard of hotel and location. When I had read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor I was honestly worried about going to stay in the Barcelo Raval because of the area in which it is situated. We had been to Barcelona before and stayed in a great hotel beside the Placa Catalunya so we knew the city. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and were given a room on the 9th floor with views over the Rambla del Raval. Very efficient friendly reception staff and a porter to take bags if we had wanted it. Room was spotless, very comfortable bed, nice big towels and the coffee machine that had been mentioned in other reviews with normal and decaff provided. There is a small supermarket 30 seconds from the hotel in which you can get bottled water. Very well stocked mini bar. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel but tried a couple of local cafes nearby and had plenty of choices of set breakfast menus. There were a few men about but no large groups and we were never approached by anyone "strange". We asked what street to use to and from the Ramblas and were advised to take the Carrer del Carme which always had people coming and going on it and wasnt so narrow as the Carrer del Hospital. We walked all over the city and did the hop on hop of bus for a day. We went out to eat in Cuidad Condal for tapas and it was so good we went back a second night which I dont think we have ever done on holiday! Always got a taxi back to the hotel at night....average price 6-7 euro and dropped right outside the door...well worth it! The rooftop at the hotel is fantastic and made even better when enjoying a cocktail or two at the end of a long day sightseeing. Didnt try the plunge pool but it would be fabulous on a really hot day in Barcelona and there were plenty of chairs and recliners up there too. All in all- a great stay in a hip and trendy hotel and all I can say is we had no bother at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy neighbourhood, unfriendly staff & lousy bed”
Reviews.Author: delladelia
Reviews.Content: First of all, I don't know how this hotel can proudly display their Tripadvisor Excellent award at their reception. The hotel is terrible. We were on our honeymoon and they gave us a room with 2 single beds, joined together to form one queen size bed (each single bed has a roller at the bottom which moved). Rooms were too dark with insufficient lighting. Hotel staff were cold & standoffish. We had stayed at other hotels in various cities in Spain and this has got to be the worst reception. And don't let me start about the ghetto neighbourhood. We we warned by so many sellers around the area to be careful. Saw a couple of prostitutes around the hotel too. Not recommended for families and young girls. Infact, I wont recommend this hotel to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless”
Reviews.Author: Naraicenworb
Reviews.Content: First class hotel. They've got the detail covered and every member of staff encountered did an excellent job of making life as easy and effortless as possible. Highly recommended. Would make a point of staying here again and recommend it to anyone. The area is no more dodgy than the gothic qtr or the ramblas itself in our view so Don't let that put you off! One of the highlights of our stay the barcelo raval.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting”
Reviews.Author: JonesBanbury
Reviews.Content: Very interesting - our room had a lovely view towards the sea but spoiled by the wire grid which makes you feel a bit like a caged bird The 'bathroom' is a shower in a glass cube, the loo is the other half of the wardrobe with a sliding door and the sink is just a ceramic one on top of the unit - no bathroom door Not the place for a couple who do not know each other VERY well before you share!! The breakfast was fab, couldnt fault it and the staff very helpful Area is a little suspect, you need to be very aware of your surroundings, at night, best way to get to town is to go down the main road(Rambla del Raval) past the Maritime Museum towards the sea which will bring you out by the column and then back up La Rambla rather than straight across

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FromtheEast
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Liked the design of the rooms, furniture and fittings - well thought out ! Liked the colour scheme & lighting in the bedrooms and generally throughout the hotel. Good, efficient service. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would definitely stay here again if returning to Barcelona. Good location to get to the highlights/attractions in the city. We had a super room with a super view (try to get room as near to the top of the hotel as possible). The terrace is really good to visit as the views from here are even better and they have binoculars set at each quadrant. the design of the bar/ lounge/ dining room is stunning. - particularly liked the swivel chairs and the ceiling. Good, comfy, large beds with pillows to match. Coffee machine in the room was good, but be careful when filling the mugs as they are a little too tall which makes it difficult to avoid spilling the contents whilst removing them from the machine. Excellent shower. Breakfast is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, weird neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Jay E
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, the staff seemed helpful and the room was very clean and well appointed (the bed was very comfortable - I slept well). The design is contemporary so it is quite a fashionable experience. My only criticism about the room was that my desk was really small, and when I needed to do some work it was not so useful - plus the seat was hard plastic with no back, so it was uncomfortable to sit there for long (but with the good wi-fi, you can move your laptop and sit on the bed I guess) The neighbourhood is a little intimidating. While nothing bad happened to me, there were groups of men hanging around everywhere and they always seemed to look me over which was weird. Also, right by the hotel there are lots of hookers (and more groups of men!) and I did not appreciate being accosted by them as I walked past. I think if you keep your street-smarts you will be fine, but some less adventurous people or elderly types may prefer to look elsewhere. (There is a taxi rank out the front door - so you don't have to walk anywhere if you don't want however)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, SKETCHY Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Teebs718
Reviews.Content: Staying here is like staying in a room designed by whomever designed the Virgin America planes. There's no overhead light and everything is cast is this pink glow that makes you feel like you're at a night club. Amenities are nice and room is a decent size for a European hotel... my one complaint is no tissue box. Seriously, you can't figure out a way to fit in a tissue box? Also, my husband got pick pocketed in the neighborhood on our last night in this hotel which obviously colors my opinion of this hotel's location but should not be discounted since based on previous reviews this seems to be par for the course. There's a good five minute walk to Las Ramblas from the hotel and although the street is not a narrow one it is filled with sketchy characters. I am from NYC and I've been in sketchy areas before and I will definitely vouch for this hotel being located in a sketchy sketchy neighborhood. It's a cool hotel, but not worth getting pick pocketed. My advice is don't stay near Las Ramblas. I read all of the reviews and thought "hey, I've been in sketchy neighborhoods, the hotel sounds cool so I'm sure I can handle it." We were walking back home from dinner at around 10pm on Carrera Hospital street and some dude came up trying to bum a cigarette and then started kicking my husband in his chin (actually cut his chin up) and then when my husband pushed him away he jammed his hand into my husband's front jean pocket (where he happened to coincidentally have his iphone) and stole the phone. By the time my husband had grabbed the guy's hand he had already passed it off to his friend who ran down an alleyway and disappeared. We were extremely careful with where we had our stuff stored in our pockets (no back pockets, nothing easily accessible), but as you can see the thieves in this neighborhood are diligent in their thieving and even willing to resort to physical violence to get what they want. Heed the warnings of your fellow travelers and stay somewhere else. You can take your chances and you may be the one person that doesn't happen to get pick pocketed in this neighborhood but just know that makes you the exception and not the rule.

Reviews.Title: “Raval area is nice!”
Reviews.Author: robeland
Reviews.Content: I liked the Raval area. It´s not scary at all. In fact it´s a good mix of different nations and cultures. A lot of independent stores and only 500m from La Rambla. I would recommend friends to stay here when the visit Barcelona. The room was also awesome - but you better not be a shy person :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Afraid!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityTravelBug
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of Barcelo Raval, we were a little afraid to stay there. However, we'd already been booked by our travel agent, so we thought we'd suck up our courage and stick with it. We are so glad we did. I don't know if those who wrote about how scary it is are just not used to being in a big city, or if we just got lucky, but we did not have one negative experience in the area around the hotel. We weren't even scared a little bit. Be smart, don't put your wallet in your back pocket, keep an eye on your purse, like you would in any crowded area. My husband agreed to wear a messenger bag, so that solved everything for us; wallet in the bag, no purse for me. One night, we went for pizza at the area right outside the hotel (the pizza was actually really good) and there was this big local family sitting next to us. Their kids went running off and the parents weren't alarmed, so obviously the locals aren't too afraid either. Also, big fireworks started going off and everyone just started getting up and cheering and it was kind of magical (seems every other day is some sort of holiday in Spain). The hotel is hip (even though the iron cage that makes it look cool from the outside blocks the view a little from your window), with a nice clientele. Our room was small, but not too small, and the view was a little strange (it faced a concrete courtyard that I think the employees hung out in), but it was high enough to see over everything and see the beautiful sea beyond the city, so we were able to ignore the courtyard. Easy to walk everywhere, top bar with a view of the city was fabulous. The staff was helpful, and it was easy to get on the computers in the lobby. For the money, I think this is the best place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the area”
Reviews.Author: Dave&Rae
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, very modern, clean, comfy and bright rooms. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel, breakfast was very expensive and you can get it for half the price at any of the local cafes on the street. The street and surrounding area as previously mentioned is not great, groups of men loitering around created a pretty uneasy atmosphere in our opnion, walking to and from the hotel was not pleasant to the point we were trying different streets and routes each time to try and find the busiest best lit one. We didn't experience any trouble and were not actually bothered by anyne but the location and area would mean we not recommend this hotel or stay there again. A shame as the hotel is very nice the rooms are super modern with free wifi, nespresso machines and great lighting which can not always be said of city centre hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sjst-01
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel - very clean, very modern and a very warm welcome. We loved it because it was so different to normal everyday hotels because of the funky decour, low multi coloured lighting etc. One of the reasons we chose this hotel is because we stay away on a regular basis in 'traditional' style hotels, which can be very boring and they all seem the same - so this hotel really stood out! We were made to feel very welcome when we arrived and throughout our stay, the staff couldnt do any more for us! Great location - only 10 mins to the heart of the City, Las Ramblas, and a very pleasant 15 mins walk to the harbour area which is so lovely. Close enough to walk to all amenities but far enough away to be quiet. The reception staff told us to use only the main streets to get to Las Ramblas and stay away from the side streets - some very good advice! The rooms are very clean, the beds are reallyscomfortable, and because its glass all round the views are great! We loved the roof top viewing area - although it was early season when we visited, it was still lovely to sit out and enjoy the wonderful views. The hotel is very tall and because its a round hotel you get 360 degrees of amazing views - a great way to start each day! The only downsides are that the low lighting can in some places be too low - for example the stairs. I prefer to use the stairs rather than the lift and I found these to be too dark and in need of more lighting - but its really not an issue if you prefer the lift! Also the air conditioning unit was very noisy. Although we have not plans to stay in Barcelona again, we have already looked into staying in other Barcelo hotels for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Super modern, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugEnnis
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel just a few minutes walk from las Ramblas. Stunning views across the city. Bright and spacious rooms, wonderful rooftop terrace with cooling pool and the best Sunday brunch in town. Breakfast is a bit steep but there are plenty of cafes in the square outside to choose from. Staff courteous and helpful. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish place in a rather unique part of Barcelona surrounded by interesting people who like protesting and feeding the homeless”
Reviews.Author: jaime_voyage7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a fab modern hotel give minutes walk from las ramblas. In an interesting neighbourhood full of many cultures which was fab. There seemed to be a commune or head office for a group of protestors directly across the road from the hotel - the building covered in graffiti and banners but I don't know what they're talking about as I don't speak Spanish. Also next to the hotel there seemed to be a group of kind people who'd set up an eating point for the homeless of the area on the Sunday which was very sweet. Strange to have something do luxurious in such a neighbourhood. The hotel shower is awesome and the room is comfy and modern. I emailed three months in advance via booking.com to request for a room with a double bed and not a twin bed - however on arrival at the hotel we were sent to a room in the fifth floor which had two single beds pushed together. I called down to reception and the rather exasperated receptionist explained that that hotel was full and there wasn't anything she could do. I told her that wasn't good enough as I'd emailed three months before to request a room without beds pushed together - I also requested a room on a high floor (both tips I got from this site) and said I wasn't happy with her answer and tht u would come downstairs and show her he emails from booking.com from her colleague Eli who said that we could have the double bed without an issue providing we arrived early - we got there at 2pm! She relented and asked to call me back. She called back and said she would 'upgrade' us free of charge to a kingsize bed - there are these rooms on all floors however as my boyfriend punted out they had ads on reception offering to upgrade to a kingsize bed on a high floor for an extra 20 euros per night - ridiculous as if you book a double room rather than a twin you should get a double bed. Make sure you email and specify this at you booking so you dont get ripped off. The "upgraded" room was smaller than the first however with one big bed rather than two singles! Make sure you get what you pay for as this place isn't cheap and why should you miss out! Only annoying thing in the room is the alarm which flashes all night! Don't try to cover it up as security will come and knock on your door!!! Enjoy your stay and the blissful shower!

Reviews.Title: “very modern”
Reviews.Author: ASSAGGI
Reviews.Content: was nice, very different, but too modern for my liking so got boring quick. great location very central. great service, comfy bed and AMAZING shower :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lalablue426
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I thought this Hotel was going to be terrible location wise I found it wonderful.....I felt no threat at all and I am a woman. The Hotel itself is ok...kinda dark a bit to MOD for me though the rooftop is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “VERY cool hotel, great service, lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: jdub621
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before trying a couple of nights in the ME Melia (very disappointing). For half the price, this hotel was far better in terms of service, comfort, and location! Wish I had stayed here the whole time! GENERAL Multilingual staff at reception (good English!); awesome view from the roof! Major landmarks are indicated with additional information. Pool is extremely small. Breakfast is GREAT, though it can get crowded. HUGE variety, definitely worth it. Lounge/restaurant/breakfast area is a fun place to hang out. Design is super cool---there's just no other way to describe it. It's definitely a "one-of-a-kind" experience. ROOM Probably not a good place to stay with someone you don't know very well :) The shower is "integrated" into the room with fairly transparent glass on both sides. Wonderful "waterfall" shower head, though. Cool sliding door for bathroom/closet area. Awkward sink area with no place to put soap. Very comfortable bed, cool lighting, neat electric window curtain (good blackout drapes). GREAT toiletries provided (razor, toothbrush, etc. in addition to the norm), and the Nespresso is a great touch. The room comes with STACKS of information about Barcelona, things to do, and places to eat. The only thing that has me confused is the difference between the "Deluxe" and "Superior" rooms. I expected my Deluxe to come with a few extra touches, like slippers and bath robes, but they were noticeably absent. So, I'm not sure what "extras" I paid for. NEIGHBORHOOD It is in a "unique" neighborhood, but it's very convenient to Las Ramblas (10 mins walking). I would say the neighborhood is no less safe than Las Ramblas (watch those wallets and purses!) or a typical ride on the metro. Coming from the US, I find Europe to be much safer in general. Maybe more petty thefts and vagabonds, but definitely no violent crime. That said, Barcelona is probably THE world's worst city for wallet/purse snatchers. Be smart and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 2011”
Reviews.Author: Francos_Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled on our honeymoon in December 2011, and loved this hotel. The front desk staff were absolutely amazing, and recommended what ended up being our favorite restaurant in Barcelona...Ciudad Condal. The neighborhood is odd, but only a 5-10minute walk to Las Ramblas, so the convenience was fantastic. From our window we could see the oceam ,which was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the beaten track, but great nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: Range78
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a 5 night stay and whilst we were sightseeing and didn't spend a geat deal of time at te hotel itself, it was a great base for a proper tour of the City. Just beware that breakfast times change dependant whether the weekend or weekday, a fact that we were not advised. Funky decor, polite staff. only a five minute walk from La Ramblas. We would go there again if we wanted to visit Barcelona. We used our Tesco Clubcard vouchers to book the hotel too, which meant value wise, it could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Clodaghhbellina
Reviews.Content: Rooftop terrace, modern rooms and in a convenient location surrounded by cool quirky bars. Atmosphere in the bar itself was quite lively too. Loved my stay here and would definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “crazy looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritravelerri
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks really great (modern,cozy and a little bit oddball).It`s a bit dark but that gives charm and romantic atmosphere. They have Nespresso coffee machine and complementary coffee but somebody forgot to put nice espresso cups (they have only large cups for those who like huge coffee with milk). The hotel is situated in one of the oldest districts of Barcelona and everything can be reached by foot. Only disadvantage is that the district seems a little bit unsafe.We were walking all the time even during night and nothing happened but for the people who don`t like to see strange faces this would be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “So close.... so far”
Reviews.Author: TomYamFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: The Location of the Hotel is close to perfect. It's close to the ramblas but far away from the anoying crowds and traffic. Just a 4 Minutes walk and you are at the Opera Liceu at the ramblas or a 15 Minutes walk to the port and marina. The Airport Bus is just a 10 Minutes walk as well. The Staff is very friendly and professional and helpful any time. The rooms are 70s Style with a Barcelona touch. TV with a lot of major european channels. A big safe for computer and cameras as well. Rooms still very new and perfect room service. Even a Nespresso Machine with 4 cups grand cru a day free of charge. Breakfast ist extensive. Totilla, Eggs, Mediteranien Vegetables, and a big variety of ham, spanish sausage etc. The restaurant is very stylish and has a nice atmposphere. The roof top 360 grade Bar which is perfect to spend a quit hour after a walking the city. Sunbeds, a pool, and a spellbounding view over barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “just like in the pictures”
Reviews.Author: travelagentTelAviv
Reviews.Content: well to the hotel i give 5 stars for me, everything was so amazing, from breakfast, to the rooms and the roof, and the staff, don't dare to make calls from your room, you will be suprised when you'll check out. except that, the bed was so confy, everything was amazing. but the neighborhood was a bit scary and over whelming, people are scary, and the girls that work out there are spooky. but if you look for a good hotel to stay, i truly recommend it. just take taxis :) their waiting out there

Reviews.Title: “Disign hotel, but poor service...”
Reviews.Author: fjcorreia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a new alternative area... The Raval. Near the hotel you have friendly tascas and litle stores, but you have also some people with strange and some times dangerous look. The rooms are small but with cool ekea fourniture. The staff could be more helpfull, and they didn't give any try to understand your needs. The restaurante as very nice ambience, but food is poor. I assedio for a cow dish but they served a porky dish... It was a total desaster! Becarfull if you have some religious ishues.

Reviews.Title: “The reason we chose Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Christos S
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Raval was the reason we chose to go for vacations in Barcelona. As onwers of a small hotel also we recognised the very good job in facilities, amenities and the decoration. Fast wi-fi internet helped us to organize our work and plans. The lighting was relaxing and the view from the 9th floor we stayed was amazing. We think that for approx 120 euros slippers and bathrobes should be included, but anyway the whole concept was excellent. Stuff and mainly Julian helped us for our walk and eating interests. Food in the restaurant was one the best we tryed in the whole town but unfortunately we did not stayed to have some fun which happens every Thursday to Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Publisher2
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews so wasn't really sure what to expect. We caught an early flight from London so pitched up at the hotel at 11:30 local time not even thinking about earliest check in times however no problem for the receptionist, a young lady called, I think, Eli, very professional multilingual (including English!!). Our room wasn't ready so she simply switched us to one that was, a 'delux matrimonial' !! The lifts are colour coded, blue, pink and green so a lot of fun had over the weekend picking our colours!!. Room itself fantastic. 9th floor electronic control for curtains, curved walls (the hotel is cylindrical) massive bed, complimentary towelling robes, safe, mini bar, coffee perculator. shower was, as previous reviwers have mentioned, slightly open plan but not really a problem. Breakfast simply fantastic, tea/coffee, buffet scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, mushrooms and roasted peppers (!?) not really full english but good nonetheless. also cheese, meats various breads, pastries, yoghurts, fruit juices, cakes, fruit, the list goes on but all excellent. Duty manager very visable at all times. Didn't have lunch or dinner in the hotel but it was fairly busy and lots of locals which is always a good sign (except for a dog which accompanied it's owners to lunch in the hotel. Typically English perhaps (but my companion is Afghan and she felt the same way) but feel uneasy about hygene when animals are allowed around food but experienced this in a lot of European countries so maybe it's me!! The hotel is a short walk from las ramblas, the main (and really interesting ) drag but getting there does mean a walk down a couple of small streets where working girls are rather obvious. Not a problem and didn't feel threatened (although my partner was uncomfortable) and in the end we turned right out of the hotel and then right again into las animals which was a better street onto los Ramblas On departure we had to check out by noon but our flight wasn't until evening but the hotel has a system for storing baggage with a designated secure room and baggage tag system. the 360 degree roof top viewing gallery was good, as previously mentioned by other reviewers the 'pool' is really a large tub but as it was late November we weren't planning on taking a dip!! All in all a great experience, the hotel is good value and the service professional, no complaints at all really

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwood1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in November 2011. Staff were excellent and very helpful. Happy to provide recommendations for nearby restaurants and attractions. Rooms were fantastic; stayed on the 9th floor and had a great view overlooking Montjuic. Breakfast was a little pricey, but as it was paid for by Tesco vouchers i had no complaints. Swimming pool isn't really a pool as described by other reviews, but there is a good gym for those looking to work up an appetite. Area is a little shady, but just do a right out of the hotel & you'll be fine Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “As funky as impersonal”
Reviews.Author: BaldwinNL
Reviews.Content: If you are into futuristic design this could be the place for you as it was for me. Outside and inside is designed with gusto of a modern James Bond movie. So stylish and a bit tacky at the same time. The bad thing though is that they also seem to have implemented the cool welcome James Bond gets from his enemies. So in the sterile environment very little staff or movement is to be seen. As for the location issues the other advisors here mention. We didn't see the streetwalkers on our way to the Ramblas, and alas, in Barcelona as a tourist chances to get confronted with muggers are almost as high as not getting mugged, regardless the area. I once got robbed twice in three days in Barcelona in totally different locations, but yet love the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best start for City Exploration”
Reviews.Author: Marcel G
Reviews.Content: Neat Design Hotel, Large room and comfortable beds. Shower with great street view. Good music in restaurant and bar. Better not to walk ouside at night if you are not confident, just take a taxi from and to hotel. Neigbourhoud during day is safe (lots of police) and try to visit some of the bars and restaurants in the direct hotel area. I have been in many hotels in Barcelona and this is my favorite as strat for Barcelon City Trip. Close to Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “sketchy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: funrazher
Reviews.Content: after traveling all night we were lucky to be able to get an early check in at the raval. the pink lights all around make the hotel appear to be modern and fun. the problem began when we turned on the lights in our room. the lights over the beds are either dark pink or green. other lights are normal but it's tough to read in bed without feeling like you're in a pink light district, which actually you are. i read reviews saying not to turn right out of the hotel and they were right. we really did see hookers. the neighborhood feels oddly sketchy. while it's a short walk to the ramblas, getting there and back at night never felt really secure. but the full-time security guards in the lobby made us feel safe inside. the rooms are average size for europe and the showers are great. beware - you share a toilet with a closet, well not really share but the two have a common wall and sliding door so if someone is on the pot and someone else needs to get into the closet, beware! breakfast was pretty good but way over priced. front desk help was very helpful with directions, helping make train reservations and dinner suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* Service”
Reviews.Author: LenAndSueOnTour
Reviews.Content: Just back from an interesting stay at the Barcelo Ravel, as others have said the hotel is very stylish, some of which works very well (lovely rainfall showers & extrememly comfortable beds) others which don't (no sockets by the beds & see through walls in the shower). My main two gripes are the location, next to an area occupied by streetwalkers (where we were approached by potential muggers on 2 occasions) and the level of service from the front desk. Having booked a Double room, I naturally expected a double bed but was given a twin (I was told this needed to be specified on the booking form, why, it was a Double room not a Twin room) and later found out there are only 4/5 double bedded rooms per floor. On trying to resolve this I was told we couldn't be moved until the following morning but we would be upgraded to compensate. No upgrade was forthcoming in the morning and the front desk were unaware that any move had been arranged when I went down to check, nobody in authority would talk to me so I emailed the hotel from my room & that was ignored as well. I couldn't tell anyone that this was a good place to stay based on the cost, location and poor service, I would suggest you look elsewhere, away from the Ravel district.

Reviews.Title: “Food&Water Prices”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel 7th to 10th nov,this was our second stay at this hotel.the hotel is very comfortable and very central,the rooms are lovely and clean, our room was on the 9th floor,also the staff were very nice.However a bottle of water in our room was 6euro,There is worse to follow, breakfast at 25euro is outrageous we cannot afford these prices as we are pensioners maybe these prices are ok for business people but not for us what a great pity.We went out to have breakfast.One last thing getting out of the bath in my opinion is very dangerous,this could easily be remedied by fixing a handrail.

Reviews.Title: “stylish”
Reviews.Author: Geichenko
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for the extended weekend with a friend. rooms might look a bit unusual, especially the shower))) but generally hotel is very beautiful. rooftop view is fantastic. very helpful and polite stuff. i would love the room to be a bit bigger in space, but it did not spoil my overall impression. Also, would recommend to try food from the hotel restaurant - it was really great. good selection of cocktails in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Mid Week Trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dianaandco
Reviews.Content: Hi Again :) This was my first trip to Barcelona. I took my daughter of 9yrs to Barcelona so we could both immerse ourselves in its beautiful architecture. I had been given all the usual scare stories about pick-pockets. And bought a security wallet and took clothing that would not make me look like a tourist ( At least and expensive one!). However, on arrival the place was full of people looking like tourists, carrying Loui bags and nice cloths :( I actually felt a little undressed. I did the usual search on TA to find the hotel with the best reviews within our budget. We both chose the Barcelo Raval because it 1) looked so different 2) close to La Rambla 3) price via Ebookers was unbeatable. On arrival the hotel was just as it looked on the internet. The best part was the 360 degree views from the top of the hotel, with a glass balcony showing images of the sights you should see if you look in a certain direction. My daughter and I loved the querkyness of the hotel. The reception staff and the cleaners were all very helpful and pleasant. The catering staff was different. Day 1 & 2 we had breakfast and a lovely man said we could sit anywhere and my daughter was f.o.c. This was great because neither of us eat a lot in the morning and 18Euros per adult is a lot :). The table staff were not very pleasant and welcoming, they just seemed to ignore you and clear tables. Day 3 the lovely man had gone and was replaced by a lady who told me that I had to pay full price for my daughters breakfast. When I told her that she couldn't do that given we had been charged a different price for the past 2 days, she became very loud and angry and refused to calm down. She was making such a seen, but on principle was not going to accept it. I went to reception and told them how she had behaved and they told me not to worry and they would sort it. Bless them they did and we got the same price but she made us feel uncomfortable which was unprofessional. I would recommend the hotel but not for children on a long stay. Despite the location which was only a very short walk to La Rambla, the hotel is for adults. Children need space and an indoor pool (at that time of year). Food in Barcelona wasn't geared towards children. I didn't find a single restaurant that offered a kids menu! The hotel did offer concessions for children but it was adult food and not fun food kids enjoy on holiday. Places to visit - We did all the Gaudi stuff, the beach and port, Barcelona Cathedral, Music/Oprah Tours and Picasso. Places were expensive to visit and it was a shame that more places didn't offer free admission for children under 11yrs. There was so much more we wanted to do, so I think another trip will be on the cards when my daughter is older. Would I recommend the hotel? Yes for adults Would I recommend Barcelona? Yes Did I find it expensive? Very I hope you find this helpful! Diana.

Reviews.Title: “A top weekend without the kids”
Reviews.Author: simonrose3095
Reviews.Content: A taxi from the airport was a 20 minute run. Great hotel in an 'up and coming area'. There were seedy side streets very close to the hotel, but they could be avoided simply, and the place felt safe the whole weekend. No more than 15 mins walk to the port or Placa Catalunya. The room was clean and airy. A fantastic comfortable bed and an unusual layout was good too. Beware the mini bar prices, and even the rooftop terrace was a little more expensive than I'd normally look to pay. But then again, you're in a good hotel - you expect to pay a little over the odds. Breakfast was buffet style, both continental and English style - great for setting you up for the day. Not a hotel I'd choose to revisit with the kids, but for another kid free trip I'd definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Modern....”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTwo_10
Reviews.Content: Well located and with a very interesting design, the Hotel was very confortable and well mantained. The terrace on the 11th floor, the 360º louge bar is very good and you can enjoy a very good view of Barcelona, all arround. One day the maid forgot to leave one towel in the room, but it was not too bad, just a remark. I would like to go there again...

Reviews.Title: “We simply love it !!!”
Reviews.Author: yasmin y
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel alot , so clean , so weird and funky , very cozy and romantic , staff were very helpful and nice , room was very comfortable , breakfast was so delicious . It was 5 min only walking away from the hotel to " Las Ramblas Street " many people warned us to be aware from pickpockets in the neighborhood but thank God nothing happened to us , we are very happy we choosed it and we will absolutely choose it in next trips . Thank you Barcelo !!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, style over substance”
Reviews.Author: hayleyansell
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go away I like a little touch of luxury and usually this is reflected in the price. Although the price of this hotel falls in this bracket it's not a luxury feel hotel. The tolietries, bed and size of room along with the fact that you only get a shower(with no privacy) and no bath all have the feel of a motel.The lighting in the room is not practical and the air conditioning is noisy and not efficent. the first room we had overlooked a dodgy building- so it is possible to get a bad view. We were moved the next night with no problem. On the plus side the staff are friendly, the sheets are nice and the concept of the hotel is designed well- although personally I'd rather a bit of comfort than the impressiveness of a 360 degree terrace- which is available to anyone who wants to buy a drink you don't have to stay here. Would be happy if I'd used clubcard vouchers to pay for the trip but hotel is overpriced for one not on the Ramblas itself and lacks the luxury touch to really make it special. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Beatriz421
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel... the rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. You have a great view no matter what room you stay at because of the shape of this hotel. The staff is very friendly and go out of their way to assist you with any questions or concerns. WiFi is free in your rooms and if you don't have a computer you have access to four Apple desktops at the lobby - free of charge. The hotel is in a great location because you are minutes away from the Ramblas. We went out late at night and had no issue getting back to the hotel... so it doesn't feel scary or dangerous to walk around at odd hours. We were also close to the metro and the tourist buses. There are a lot of shops/restuarants at walking distance. The Boqueria Market is an interesting place to check out for fresh fruits/juices and meats. The Hard Rock is also at walking distance as well as other interesting sites like their churches, muesums and even some flamenco shows. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close enough to the Ramblas and experience a friendly staff and comfortable huge rooms for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: zstamp333
Reviews.Content: First I shall start by saying as we drove up we were slightly worried about some of the areas the taxi drove through etc to get there and thought omg where are we staying.... but!!!! when we got through the funky pink doors and into the hotel lobby we could have been anywhere and it wouldn't have mattered! The area... same as some people have said before, we made the mistake of coming out the hotel and turning right down the first road, to start with it was fine but it led to an area which clearly was at night time the almost red light district road... women clearly ready and waiting for the police to disappear so they can start business early (it was only about 4pm and they were already waiting for 'customers' - dont let this put you off, we didn't, we just went straight out the hotel, walked forwards down past the little bars and restaurants then turned right at the end, shops all along the road, keep going for quite a while and you end up on a side road that then joins "las ramblas" this is where the street performers etc are, and many shops, restaurants etc, this also leads to the square where the 'tourist bus' departs every day. Safety: everyone we had spoken to about Barcelona had warned us about pick-pockets and thieves etc. We went prepared (purses inside a bag that has an inner zip and a travel wallet that has a chain you can clip to something else but I have to say we didn't notice anyone trying at all but there are old ladies going around asking for money but ignore them and they go away. Travel: there are two companies that do a 'tourist open top' type bus, we used the one called 'tourist bus' they run three main lines of buses, blue, red and green. Tip... buy your ticket first along "las ramblas" then join the que waiting for the bus, this que is because although there are LOTS of buses, everyone waits for the upstairs open deck to be free, dont do this, get on when they come along saying anyone for downstairs, then the first stop people get off, anyone downstairs gets asked if they want to go upstairs now before the new people get on.... we found this bus was a great way to get around, metro maybe cheaper but wasn't wanting to be constantly checking my bag wasn't being robbed as most of the thieving seemed to be happening on the metro itself. On the bus make sure you do things in order on the route, I made the mistake of getting the bus not thinking about the fact that the one attraction we wanted to do (zoo) was towards the end of the route and so taxi would have been a better idea but instead we had to wait on the route for 2.5 hours till we got there....oppps!!! :( Finally.... Hotel! This hotel is super modern and funky, some may say tacky but I thought it was expensive enough a feeling to not cross that line. Nearly everything is, black, white, pink or green...and 'different'/ 'funky' enough that I felt the need to photo it, even the lights etc are 'cool' staff seemed friendly enough to me, though didn't need to speak to many. The rooms are lovely, bright and clean... minor negatives... unless we were being stupid, I dont think you could actually put the plug on the sink in so you can fill it but could be wrong, also the shower, its amazing but you really need to be close to the person your sharing with as although the side is frosted in places you can still pretty much see the other person. Great for couples but maybe awkward for a friends trip away. Overall I loved this trip, barcelona and the hotel... I would go back again happily!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: capeluloboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Tesco vouchers for a cheap break in Barcelona. The hotel is very modern and chic, the rooms are extremely comfortable and well kitted out and all the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. Some reviews comment unfavourably on the location and although some of the surrounding streets may be a bit shabby we felt entirely comfortable wandering to and fro, night and day. Having a glass of wine and watching the sun go down on the roof terrace is a fabulous way to start an evening in Barcelona and the drink prices aren't too bad for a swanky hotel, although some youngsters with more bottle than us brought their own!

Reviews.Title: “Cool design hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Annaistockholm
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a cool interior. The beds are comfy and the rooftop bar is very nice with a great view. The location is very good, just one block from La Rambla, central but quiet. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Design Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Fjbritton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Jr. Suite #910. PROS: - huge room with great lighting and incredible views of Barcelona - the rooftop terrace has a breathtaking panoramic view of the city - friendly and accommodating staff - and attractive :) - the location is close to everything yet away from the crowds CONS: - slightly expensive... but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: WinemerchantPoole
Reviews.Content: Great location,5 mins to Ramblas,nice square outside with cafes and bars,at great prices.Bedroom was fab with great views of Barca,and the bed was big and very comfortable.Waterfall shower in bathroom was great,even had a shower when i didnt need one. Rooftop bar was good,but whats that swimming pool all about, better to throw a few koi carp in and make it a feature or fill it in to give extra space. Breakfast was pretty average,no egg chef,and clearance of tables was very slow,crockery piling up. Front desk were excellent,and will def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecta”
Reviews.Author: carebearvegas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and then read reviews on it. After reading many reviews I thought perhaps I had made a mistake and was seriously considering cancelling, boy am I happy that I did not cancel. First allow me to say that the personnel at this hotel are outstanding. I brought a converter that I did not know how to work, they had one for me. The alarm clock I could not operate, they came up to our room and set the alarm for me. We arrived mid-morning after a cruise, they held our luggage. All of this was performed in a very friendly and positive manner. The manager-on-duty is present at all times 24/7. The Barcelo Raval has a 360 degree terrace that offers amazing views of Barcelona, and is worth staying at this hotel alone for. I know people say the pool is very small and it is, but who cares when the terrace view is so magnificent. Barcelona has great beaches. The area was not as intimidating as I read at all. We ate right outside the hotel at several outdoor restaurants and the employees of the restaurants look out for their patrons. One employee noticed a woman had her purse on the ground and he requested she better secure it. Another employee pointed out a purse thief to us. They know what is going on and who is a thief. We received excellent service here as well. The employees at the Barcelo Raval will offer you for purchase a hop on/off voucher, and am I happy they did. This was a wonderful service and experience. We walked from our hotel to Las Ramblas every moring and came home the same way every evening and we never had one problem. Not a single problem. We started our day with the breakfast buffet at the hotel and we were both very pleased with the selections they offer. This is a wonderful hotel with wonderful service. My sister and I were treated very well by everyone we came into contact with in Barcelona (with the exception of a waiter on Las Ramblas who wanted to know if I was American and then would not help me - his bad.) If you are considering this hotel and area I hope this review helps you. I would stay here again and again. Happy travels to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: Tman312
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for adults only, very comtemporay (say Philippe Starck meets the Jetson's). Excellant roof-top bar with 360 views of the city. Location is close to all major city attractions (however be advised it's in the process of gentrification). It's very chic and up-scale. I thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. Asked for your room to be cleaned by a certain time otherwise you could arrive back at your room at say 5 PM to find it still uncleaned. My wife and I would definitely come back to this hotel. It's also priced very reasonable for Barcelona. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Really not a nice neighbourhood. Not recommended for families.”
Reviews.Author: MNaus
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the staff here to go out of their way to help or provide customer service. They act like it's below them. The biggest concern is the neighborhood. All of the streets between the hotel and La Rambla felt really unsafe. Lots of working girls and desperate looking predators. My wife and daughter would not leave the hotel after dark on foot. Would not go back !!

Reviews.Title: “I agree, the service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: gnaplus
Reviews.Content: I haven't even stayed at this hotel. I tried to, for 4 days, writing them an email, from their own web site, in both English and Spanish and and having to re-send the email 3 times. Four days later, I still haven't heard from them. Considering another gentleman's comments about the lack of courtesy and poor demeanor at this hotel, I'm going to take our 30 room nights in Barcelona to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel marred by surly staff, bad neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelo Ravel for 4 nights along with my wife from Sept 16 - 20, 2011. This hotel is located about a 5 minute walk away from Las Ramblas, the main drag in Barcelona. While the location is great for those of you who favor being out to all hours and soaking in the sights and sounds of Barcelona at night, my wife and I were disappointed in our stay and glad to check out so that we didn't have to stay another evening in the Del Raval neighbourhood. It's not that it is particularly unsafe, it's that it makes you feel uneasy. It could be the walk down C/Hospitalier to Las Ramblas at dusk or when you are returning late at night, or it could be the scores of sketchy looking people dotting the street, the stray dogs or the children running around with no parents and/or Islamic men in full gear staring at you or yelling at each other, but it just has a funny vibe. Nothing ever happened to me or my wife while we were there, but there was just something about the neighbourhood that made us walk quicker and breathe a sigh of relief when we were inside the hotel for the night. Hotel The hotel itself is extremely clean and well-appointed for the price point. I think it is trying for an ultra-modern/futuristic vibe because the lighting throughout the hotel seems to be all pink or silver, and the furniture in the rooms itself (while comfortable) looks like something out of a 2030 version of the IKEA catalogue. Rooms were very clean and the housekeeping staff obviously do an excellent job of keeping everything spotless. Truly, well done!! My only gripe with the hotel (aside from the neighbourhood) is the staff. Surly is the word that most quickly comes to mind. Julian on the front desk during check-in and check-out seemed to be in a bad mood. Not sure what was wrong with him, but perhaps a smile might be in order considering he is the first person you see when you walk in. But lest you think I am picking on him, let me assure you that his attitude and complete lack of helpfulness is shared by all the men and women who man that front desk. They can't be bothered to help and they seem to resent if you have the gall to ask them if they speak English. Oh well. My dealings with them were few and far between and of that, I am glad. I am also not sure who the older men in the sports jackets standing just inside the front door were supposed to be -- if they were security, they should a) get off their cell phone and b) dress more professionally. There was always at least one of these guys standing just inside the door -- who were they? I have no idea. They didn't offer to take our bags or help us with anything, and they sure didn't do much beyond yap on their cell phones or talk to the front desk clerk. The hotel also has a nice terrace -- and a very VERY small pool on the same level. Nice view but if I want an even better view, I'll go up to Montjuic. Overall, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay that is reasonably priced only minutes away from Barcelona's version of Times Square, then this is the place for you. However, if you are uncomfortable in neighbourhoods that are best described as sketchy and have an issue with surly, cranky staff, then please stay elsewhere. We certainly will be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent, trendy”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. It's a very trendy hotel that looks and feels upscale, with a sweet lobby and friendly staff. Rooms are fit for purpose: beds are comfortable, there's a desk and free wifi so that you can do your work (or just surf the internet), and the bathroom has a nice rain-shower. It's hard to be both romantic and business-oriented, but this hotel manages it. My only criticism is that some "double beds" are actually just two single beds pushed together, which can create some uncomfortable moments. It would be easily solved with a small carpet underneath the beds, which might also give a bit of warmth to the room as well. But - I am not an interior decorator. Regarding the area - yes, it's in a neighbourhood that a real estate agent might call "vibrant" (i.e. street prostitution goes on around the corner) and "energetic" (i.e. it's best to walk briskly and with a sense of purpose). I had no problems, however, and hopefully you won't either.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-Gaucho
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a well located hotel in Barcelona and I found this one very convenient. It's a few blocks away from "Paseo La Rambla" in a nice avenue called Paseo Rambla del Raval. It's extremely modern, with a nice lobby (always full of beatiful people) and a terrace bar with a breathtaking view of Barcelona. The rooms are modern, with everything you need. A few fancy details: * The curtains can be opened or closed with a remote control on your bedstand * You can also play your Ipod in a modern speaker center * You can turn on the neon-like liights on the headrest of the bed, creating a sensual atmosphere (if needed)

Reviews.Title: “Great balance between work and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: marianarrs
Reviews.Content: I already stayed in this hotel twice while attending conferences in Barcelona. This hotel is wonderful for people that travel for work but also want to relax and have fun when the working hours are over. It has an amazing terrace with a 360 degrees view over barcelona, where one can have a drink and relax watching the sunset. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the beds are very comfortable; one can have a very quiet sleep even staying on a busy area. Just the room desk for working is not very spacious but there is wireless available in the whole hotel and the staff is very friendly. I also tried the breakfast buffet: it has a large variety and good quality food, although it is more expensive than the average. The exception goes to the sunday brunch, which has a better price/quality ratio. I really liked this hotel and I think it is also good for tourism stays.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel but very LOUD and got card cloned in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: KimOzPom
Reviews.Content: This is a very mixed review. Wowed by the hotel. Very funky and nice touches everywhere, see others photos, but, all very nice having this iPod dock but when it goes off at 4am and you can't shut the thing up it does p@ss you off a bit. I had to unplug it and leave outside the door :) Lots of shouting outside, I know busy city and we were prepared and took earplugs but just saying. Sat night had a lovely meal in their restaurant and kind waiter went and stuck 20eu on his mobile phone top up!!!! Fkn cheek! Next day police were staking out some no doubt pick pocket from inside hotel reception. All very bring you down to earth you are staying in a big city. Recommend the bar down the road for a cocktail and the food Market for brekky or lunch. Keep off Las Ramblas for good food, it's shocking. Mirablau for a night out was ace, got home 5.30am cos I couldn't stop dancing.

Reviews.Title: “Uber modern design! Funky hotel close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Anon7643
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Ravel is a uber modern hotel with an extremely impressive lobby! It boasts amazing facilities and technology - a touch pad on the bed head controls the lighting, opens/closes curtains, controls heating and the iPod dock is also a nice touch. We were upgraded to the next room category and as soon as you walk into the room you will be impressed by the stylish, modern design. The showers are massive and the frosted glass does allow some privacy. The 360 degree views are fantastic as are the $10 euro mojitos. The swimming pool is tiny, however as a place to cool down the size is adequate. There is also a gym on the ground level, however we did not use this. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to La Rambla- Barcelo Raval is about a 20 min taxi ride to the airport and costs around $25-30 euros. We stayed at Barcelo twice- one booking for 3 nights and the next for 1 night. During the first stay the sliding door was damaged and toilet seat wobbly. We had to contact reception twice for help in resolving the sliding door issue. The hotel kindly compensated us with $10 euros worth of minibar, which was an appreciated token! On our second stay the lights in the bed head remained permanently on which was a little annoying having purple lights above your head when you are trying to sleep! Given that we returned to the hotel so late at night and were only there for 1 night we didn't bother contacting reception. We did advise them at checkout so hopefully they had a chance to rectify the issue before the next guest! Overall we would recommend this hotel to others- we paid about $155au p/night and felt that it was good value. I would however question some of the quality checks on the rooms as I would have expected staff to have noticed the broken sliding door, wobbly toilet seat and faulty lights on the bed head.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: denshires
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The room was great - bed particularly comfortable and large. Very clean, with every convenience required. Staff helpful. There is a carpark underneath the hotel which could be useful. The roof terrace is great. Drinks are expensive but are not out of the ordinary for a hotel eg glass of Cava was 5 euros and a Moquito was 7.50 Euros.Our room was on the third floor and we did have a bit of a view. I think you have to pay extra for a high room and it is probably not worth it. The local area is up and coming but I can see why some found it dodgy - especially if you are not used to cities. Don't let this put you off - it really is fine. I suggest a taxi back to the hotel if you are getting back after midnight - otherwise it is always busy and no problem. The square outside the hotel is lovely and Bar Raval was our favourite place for Tapas - we ate there twice - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Got Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: Drew W
Reviews.Content: I initially booked the hotel through Hotels.com at a fair rate of 720 Euros/4 nights. Hotels.com made a mistake and booked two junior suites for me and I only needed one suite. Hotels.com asked me to call the hotel directly and change the reservation to one suite. By doing that, the hotel decided to cancel my reservation through Hotels.com and instead made the reservation directly through their own reservation group. They also decided to raise the rate to 820 and did not mention the raise in rate until check out. I pleaded with the manager, Jordi Parente at check out but he was not helpful and quite rude. He was determined to make me pay the higher rate even though I showed him the emails confirming the changes with Hotels.com. Any other four star hotel would have been more accommodating. We tipped their housekeeping and service crew on a daily basis. So, beware and insure your rate before you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smsgirl
