Reviews.Content: I stayed at the barcelo raval for three nights with my husband as part of our holidays. It is a beautiful hotel, right in the centre of Barcelona. We had read some negative reviews regarding its location but we didn't have any issues. The room we had was really nice, very clean and exactly as advertised and we enjoyed breakfast here each morning. The pool on the roof can really only be described as a rather large bath but we were not really interested in the pool side of things. Staff were friendly and we would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “High design standard, good experience”
Reviews.Author: antocreval
Reviews.Content: I loved the first impact of the hotel, building is an amazing cylinder on the raval area. U will be impressed by the design of every single corner of the hotel, we got a top floor room with a nice view on barcelona from the inside . I loved our bath corner, very contemporary made of corian with every cm really optimised and they gave us complimentary nespresso machine which is a plus for those loving coffee. U will enjoy a round roof terrace with a small pool but no sun bed available. Breakfast was ok, complete fresh and made of good quality food.

Reviews.Title: “"Great for City breaks"”
Reviews.Author: gordonstmungos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for 1 week's city break and found this hotel was in a great location to explore the city and all of the atractions. We only had the buffet breakfast in the hotel which was really good. We ate out every night as there is a great choice of resturaunts all around the area. The hotel rooms are very clean and roomy. It is just across the road from the beach.If we booked again i would ask for a room with a sea view but it didn't really mater to much as we were out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Hot to trot - can recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: stephen787
Reviews.Content: I had booked a double room but was upgraded to Junior suite. The property is a modern design hotel, ovoid in shape with a roof top cocktail bar, view deck and tiny pool. The roof top bar and deck are popular at sunset for the fabulous view of Barcelona. The ground floor contains the restaurant and second bar which serves dinner as well as breakfast. There is also outdoor seating at ground level. Great design, very slick and modern. Staff were ok but not overly friendly. Hotel is positioned on the smaller Rambla del Raval, which is in the old quarter which I'm told is slowly being gentrified. A lot of the local shops and neighbours seem to be immigrants but it is not as dangerous as some visitor make it out to be. It's only a 5 min walk from the main La Ramblas and the wonderful La Boqueria market. I arrived from the Para Lell subway station which is only a 4 min walk to the hotel. The only downside and a very small criticism is that there were no tissues in the bathroom or free bottled water. As Spanish water is not really drinkable I'd expect at least one free bottle of water for guests rather than having to pay several euros for Fiji Water from the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel slightly seedy location”
Reviews.Author: Maldita-Chocolate
Reviews.Content: Note: Although I have put August 2010 the drop down would not let me add November 2009. We booked this as a mini moon after our wedding. We didn't pay full price as we booked through a 3rd party but we were upgraded. We loved the modern room and added extras, as it was our honeymoon the shower in the room was not a problem. The shower itself was lovely. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The view was spectacular. The swimming pool was very small and icy cold. More like a dipping pool. People have said the area is not the most attractive and it is true that it is set in the red light district, however, if you head out to your left and take a slightly longer route out you hardly notice. That said as a single woman I would be cautious of venturing out after dark. I understand they are trying to regenerate the area but red light will invariably stay as that. We didn't eat in the hotel as it was expensive and found lots of great places nearby to eat. The staff were courteous and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel with excellent amenties.”
Reviews.Author: robrobe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off the beaten track and is beautiful. The rooms are large and the lobby is beautiful with free computer access. It is a quick walk to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “very cool boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: We found Barcelo Raval on Trip Advisor and booked on lastminute.com for a great rate. The hotel is a 7-8 minute walk from the famous food market on Las Ramblas and was in a great location for sightseeing. It’s worth paying for a deluxe room. The regular rooms are on the lower floors where you will stare into adjoining buildings. From floor 6 upwards these are deluxe rooms you will have a view over the rooftops to the city skyline. We stayed on 7F and had a view across to the Cathedral. The 360 rooftop terrace is terrific for views. Rooms are modern, funky and very stylish – what you would expect from a new boutique hotel. Ours was hot pink, black and silver. Comfy bed, good bathroom. Free wifi is a bonus. Front desk staff were very helpful with restaurant and transport advice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSunworshiper
Reviews.Content: -great hotel -clean, tidy -rooms cleaned daily...soaps, toothbrush, razor, hairdryer, safe, ipod docking station, towels, fridge (with mini bar) all available -roof terrace excellent for view of barcelona and sunbathing...pool small but fine -staff friendly and helpful -breakfast great (although no cereal) -internet available -5 minute walking distance to la rambler (main strip) loads of shops bars and restaurants -20-25mins walk to beach pleasant walk -took aerobus from airport very easy to do and 15min walk to hotel (drops you at top of la rambler) -metro very easy to use would definatly go back overall great location for everything

Reviews.Title: “A bit too self-conscious to be warm”
Reviews.Author: crouchhall
Reviews.Content: We had a superior double room, 135 euros, on the 9th floor with a great view. The beds are massive - you could get two adults and a child in their comfortably, possibly with the kitchen sink as well. There are lots of cute extras - an ipod dock, an espresso machine we couldn't work out how to use, electric curtains that swoosh back to reveal a window wall looking out onto Barcelona through a mesh. You can hire a Wii, I think you can hire an iphone by the day too. Clean. Nice decor. Marble floor. There isn't a separate bathroom. The large shower is in a glazed kind of pod in the room. The sink is in the bedroom but is nicer than that sounds. All very modern. The loo door slides directly onto the room rather than being contained in a bathroom, which has its downsides.... It makes the room feel rather cluttered at one end. Breakfast is 22 euros so we didn't bother. We had room service which was really mediocre. I didn't eat it. Tapas downstairs were also mediocre. I wouldn't eat there again. The hotel is comfy but rather self-consciously over-designed. A bit like an opulent iKEA without the wood and calm. Life size plastic horses with lampshades. Pigs with tables. Teenage kids would probably love it. But it didn't feel that relaxing. Staff were polite, pleasant, and kindly let us into our room a couple of hours early. It's on the not so nice side of the Ramblas, but the area was fine. More interesting in a way than the Cathedral side which is full of chains and nothing but shops. It's 5 minutes walk to the Ramblas, 10 to Plaza Catalunya. It has a big, 360 degree roof terrace which provided a welcome breeze. 'Swimming pool' is not what I'd call the pond on the roof. It's more a splash pool, but there were people taking advantage of it. We didn't go up there at night, when I'm sure it really comes into its own. Only two lounge chairs as far as we could see, otherwise it's sitting upright on a stool or on some rather uncomfy benches. Nice to have though. I wouldn't stay there again, but it was pleasant enough. I prefer the Husa Oriente which we stayed in a couple of years ago, is a lot cheaper with lovely calm spacious rooms, and right on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in Barcelona,- view, design, food, service!”
Reviews.Author: Sofocona
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have been many times in Barcelona. I must say,- it is hard to find a nice hotel in that city, specifically near such highlights as La Ramblas and the Port. That is why I love Barcelo Raval ,- it has perfect location, great view from the roof top bar, best food at their restaurant, cleanliness, and fun design. I am an architect and appriciate the attention of Barcelonians to art and design... Afterall,- it is a city of Gaudi :-)

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: becsmile
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and modern, we were in a double bed room so the fact that the shower was in the room and not a seperate bathroom wasn't a problem not sure if the twin rooms are the same. The free wifi is really handy. 360 bar at the top of the hotel has great views. It's about a 10 min walk from les rambles but about 40 mins from the beach. Pool was a waste of time as it was tiny (the size of a hot tub!) breakfast was €18 therefore didn't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Looking building”
Reviews.Author: ravi41
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Staff are very helpful.Clean rooms, but rather small and acquired decorations.Nice locations, but the area is seedy and very ethnic. Breakfast was poor,

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice breakfast, rooms are bit too design concious neglecting functionality”
Reviews.Author: NurErt
Reviews.Content: great location, please do not mind the reviews which says it is not a safe neighborhood. The surrounding area is turkish and arabic family neighborhood and i guess some american and western european tourists could not detect that. Hotel was quite nice, great location, fantastic roof top. we had something like a premium big room, on the top floor. The restroom and the closet have an alternating door which basically means a restroom like a closet. The design of the room was OK but the sink was not. There was no towel rack or a place for soap. They could have placed some kind of a soap holder attached to the side of the sink. This was really annoying. The ipod thingy was cool, we listened to our fav tunes in the room from our own ipod. The bed was superb, not so soft or too hard. I advise to book breakfast included, it was quite good and healthy. Coffee could have been better quality though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: hzryb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barcelona Sants in roughly 3 hours from Madrid, and took a cab over to our hotel, the Barcelo Raval. I was a little nervous about the location of this hotel in the Raval neighborhood after reading some not so nice descriptions of it here on TA. The Raval is somewhat seedy, with some decidedly lower class looking Arabs and prostitutes mulling about, but there were many people on the streets at all times, and some street sense, we were not afraid to walk on any of the streets at all. (Well, my wife wasn’t thrilled with it, but I had no issues walking thru the streets of the Raval.) You can tell that this area is undergoing a gentrification, and there were many women walking alone and also women with small children, so I felt perfectly safe here. The area is also a 5-minute walk to the Ramblas, so it was pretty convenient. The hotel itself is very modern, perhaps un-necessarily Euro-trendy, but the staff was courteous (and the woman who checked us in spoke English, which we didn't find all over Spain). Read some other reviews here about the lack of privacy in the bath area; I am married, so that wasn't a huge problem, but if you are a family or 2 friends, this lack of privacy could be a problem. The lighting is as other have described... not very much light in the room; hard to read. The TV was good... although we just had it on to catch up on CNN Int'l. There were a couple of electric outlets right under the TV on the wall...easy access for my electronic gear. I've been in hotels where the access to electric outlets is difficult, and you wind up plugging in behind the desk or bed, and then forget your charger when you check out! There is a Nespresso coffee maker in the room as well as a mini bar (we did not partake of the mini bar, and the La Boqueria market place is 5 minutes away, so we brought back fruit and water, etc to the room) There is also a little grocery store across the Rambla de Raval right outside the hotel. The lobby has two iMacs with internet, and there is also free wifi available. It was easy to stay connected to email, facebook, etc. We did not eat in the hotel, although the restaurant area looked very nice... there is just too many less expensive options for meals in Barcelona. The rooftop observation deck gives you a beautiful panoramic view of the city, and the pool is very very small, but there were people sitting there every time I was up there. I think the hotel caters to a young crowd; it appeared we were the oldest people here, but there were plenty of young people milling about. That's not a negative, but just my perception. All told, the hotel is modern, and convenient to the Ramblas, with a decent sized room (especially for a European hotel). Definitely a good place to use as your home base for a BCN visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fine - hotel is very contemporary'”
Reviews.Author: alex0x0x
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at this hotel due to all the bad reviews I read about the location, but I was pleasantly surprised. Raval is commonly known to be a rough area of Barcelona, ridden with prostitutes and pick-pocketers, however, I didn't find this to be the case. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from The Ramblas and the area boasts dozens of convenience shops, pretty little tapas restaurants, bars, pharmacies...everything you could need as a tourist in Barcelona. The area holds a mixture of tourists and locals, and I can honestly say that my partner and I didn't see one prostitute or witness any sort of trouble. The hotel itself is very contemporary; everything you see from the website. My partner and I weren't particularly fans of our room though. There is no bathroom as such, with the shower being next to the bed and the toilet enclosed in very thin walls. The beds are comfy enough though, and it was clean. The roof top bars views are wonderful, but the pool is just a dipping pool and there are no sun loungers, only strange looking plastic chairs with no cushions on so it becomes almost impossible to sit down on them in the heat! If I could go back I'd make sure I upgraded to a higher room with a view as the views are beautiful. One major downfall of this hotel is language barrier with the staff: some of them don't speak great English and we had some trouble asking for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Fun room, great view”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Barcelona has a lot of great places to stay, but I think it's fair to say this is one of them. The rooms are modern, with slips toward Ikea tattiness, but they really do come together well. There was already some slight signs of wear, and I'm not sure how well it will do in the long term, but for now it has a nice feel. I had an "end" room, with huge windows with amazing views. Frankly, that sells this place. Spectacular views. Nothing better than waking up, opening the automatic curtains, and looking out on Barcelona in the morning sun. (You know, if you can manage to get up before noon.) It seems every review notes the location. I was here for a nearby conference, and so the location was ideal for me. The Raval can be a little "rough," I suppose, compared to the more touristy areas, but to me it just felt like a pleasant neighborhood. The area is undergoing serious gentrification, and and you can see that in the character of the buildings and people. Is the area "dangerous"? My taxi driver warned me to keep a good grip on my bags as I got out, and that's good advice anywhere in Barcelona, and especially in the Raval. If you are prepared and aware, you'll be OK. I was perfectly comfortable walking around with three-year old nephew in the evening. If the thought of ever seeing a prostitute scares you, then perhaps there are other places to visit. Prostitution is found throughout Barcelona, though yes, it's quite common in the southern end of Las Ramblas, and back over to the hotel. So, in all, it's a great place to stay and I'd stay here again. A bit funky, a bit fun, and great views.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, cool rooftop bar, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tara-amsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at a romantic getaway in May 2011. we were quite impressed by the hip and trendy look of the hotel. Our room on the 9th floor was spacious and all white furnished, very cool. Nice view on the ocean and Montjuic. Staff at the reception desk was very nice, and they seem to know a lot about the city. There is a rooftop bar, very nice views! We ordered Cava and strawberries in the room, this came promptly and was of very good quality. There is a gym in the basement. Free wifi, and apple computers in the lobby, free to use. We did not eat (breakfast was around 20 euros) in the hotel, since you can eat any where in BCN, and for a better price. Location: 20 mins by taxi from the airport, and about 10 minute walk to the sea, La Rambla, El Colom, so... very good central location. Downside; the Raval area is quite "lively", so indeed, some prostitutes in the area, Indian kids playing cricket on the street, halal butchershops, homeless people sleeping in corners, but also some really nice restaurants and terraces on the Rambla de Raval. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: trabbler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Barcelo hotels but this one is very below par, cleaning of rooms not done untill 5pm had to wait to get back to room. Bar very poor service lots of dirty glasses no stock in bars. Area of Barcelona where you are surrounded by East block prositutes, hence the security man in entrance hall who is trying to keep them out. Very off hand staff, not helpfull at all. Advertises swimming pool on roof which is no bigger then a bath.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views of the city, perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma_J20
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I let the hotel know that it would be my partner's 40th birthday during our stay. On check in I was delighted to find we were given a room on the 9th floor with a lovely view of the city and facing the sea. The room was a decent size and the bed was so big and comfortable it was the best sleep we ever had. We watched the sunrise one morning from our hotel room, very romantic. The curtains are electric and there is a selection of lighting even a useful night light in the toilet. We stayed for 3 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. The view from the roof top bar is spectacular as it is 360 degrees, there is helpful viewing information around the balcony. The hotel is boutique in design and very clean. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas, turn right out of the hotel and the first main street you come to is Carrer de l'hopital, turn right when you reach this street and it takes you to Las Ramblas. We didn't have much interaction with the staff except for check in and check out which was very efficient and the maids do a great job, our room and the hotel was spotlessly clean. The hotel certainly deserves it's 4 star rating. We had a fantastic time in Barcelona, my partner celebrated his 40th birthday in style and the hotel added to our unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the surrounding district.”
Reviews.Author: allisonord
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend with my dearest friend. We both share a significant birthday this year and decided to celebrate by taking our long awaited city break. I thought this hotel looked perfect, modern stylish and in a good position to walk to most of the attractions Barcelona has to offer. This was true, unfortunately it is also in the redlight district (El Raval). I asked the receptionist on arrival if we would be safe walking out at night to and from the hotel. She was very helpful and showed us on a street map the best/safest routes to take and told us not to go in the streets directly behind the hotel (ie between the hotel and La Rambla). This was good advice as that area seemed very seedy from the little we saw of it. We shared a twin room which was lovely clean and spacious although the bathroom being part of the room (ie no walls to separate it) was a lot more intimate than we were expecting, and although we took a practical approach I would not recommend it to anyone sharing with anyone they do not know extremely well!! The staff were very helpful and the bar was a great place for a nightcap after a longdays sightseeing. We did not take advantage of the rooftop terrace and pool although I am sure the view from there would be fantastic. Warning the rooms are very high tech - you have to use buttons to open and close the curtains and the lights take some working out as does the airconditioning which we never mastered. The coffe machine in the room was a bonus especially for a Spanish hotel and coffee was free. i would stay there again but probably with my spouse due to the lack of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooftop view of Barcelona,cool Hotel- Poor location”
Reviews.Author: MissFish_11
Reviews.Content: El Raval- is the red light area, with a high crime rate! just avoid the street adjacent to the hotel (San Rafeal & the area around St Augsti- use common sense & be cautious at night! Great service, amazing view from rooftop bar, vnice suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very cool, decent prices and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: oliveoil186361
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - I would definately recommend it by do some research on the prices because they vary up and down depending on when you go. To me, this is the best hotel in Barcelona. Take a coctail on the top floor or sit in the bar and enjoy the DJ. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel! Great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lomito
Reviews.Content: We came to spend a couple of days in Barcelona and a friend of us recommended us this hotel. Our experience was excellent. International staff and very friendly. Location is amazing, in the very center of the city. Very chic atmosphere in the restaurant, bar, room and a stunning terrace with great views. We had dinner at the hotel and loved it. Had the set menu which was like a selection of the whole menu, with really special dishes, and loved it. Great service, we let the staff recommend the wine for us and the choice was great and inexpensive. Had drinks at the bar and they even had a DJ willing to play music on demand! That was cool! My wife and I really enjoyed our time in Barcelona! Love to share good experiences! Would I recommend it? Most def!

Reviews.Title: “Food is unedible”
Reviews.Author: BRM_365
Reviews.Content: Hello there, I live in Barcelona and go out to eat a lot, I happened to visit the restaurant in the ground floor of the Barcelo raval and it was the most horrifying food experience I've had in years. Of the 5 dishes we ordered non of them were correct! Not even the maitre knew what the dishes had (a real danger if you have any allergy) and we had a couple of special request that of course weren't met. Besides the food no waiter or manager was available and in the last dish I had to stand up and go almost to the kitchen because was NO ONE around. If you are in the are don't waste your money, because you are going to have better attention and better food in any of the kebab places around!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location”
Reviews.Author: Taqone
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Barcelo Raval. The hotel is about 5-10min walk from the last stop of the areobus from the airport, and located just off the busy shopping street of La Rambla. From the hotel we managed to walk to all the tourist attractions around the city including the beach! The staff were nice and approachable, the restaurant there as you would expect is very expensive. the equivalent could easily be found down some side streets for a better price. there is also a nice panoramic view on the roof top on floor eleven. Moving to the room. We were placed on the 9th floor facing the street. On first impressions the room looked clean, with impressive large windows. The bed was comfortable. However everything was white which within a few hrs of staying there attracts all the dirt (not a problem as the cleaners do a great job). When you turn on the lights on at night, for some reason they have put pink LED's above the bed which makes the room look part of the red light district! You can hear some of the street level noise and noise of your neighbours entering and leaving their rooms, but didn’t find this much of a problem. The main point which I would like to point out to those considering staying at the hotel is that there is no privacy from the bed room to the shower!! there is no real screen between the bed and the shower unit and you can easily see your room mate shower whilst laying in bed.. I don't know if this was only my room, and I was staying with my girlfriend which wasn't a problem. But it would make things very awkward if I was staying with my parents or colleges!! The toilet also nearby had a sliding door with no lock and didn't close completely... so if you would like to have complete privacy, I would take this into consideration. Over all, it was a great comfortable hotel, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy rooms but worth upgrading”
Reviews.Author: belwill
Reviews.Content: Funky rooms but not very functional if staying for more than one ot two nights. Rooms bigger than what we imagined although wardrobe space very limited in the first room we were allocated. We stayed for 2 nights. The first room was on the first floor and was over looked by residential flats. No bin, bath/shower difficult to use ( although very good once we got used to the controls), wooden panel fell onto to my partner within seconds of entering the room, wc badly fitted and stiff, coffee machine needed more intstructions and leaked, no ipod charger . Air conditioning didn't work. Staff friendly and responded to requests to fix panel but couldn't provide a bin . Free safe included in room. Upgraded the next day for 20 euros a night. The first room we were offered was on the third floor with no bath just shower and the view was no better. Complained and we were given a room on the fourth floor with bath and shower ...... working air conditioning,bin & ipod charger(!!!!). Breakfast was very good although busy on the Sunday- hot and cold buffet available. Free Apple Mac available to use in the foyer. The views from the rooftop were fantastic although we only found the roof top bar open on the Saturday afternoon. I would discribe the location as the Hackney of Barcelona with a 7 minute walk to the Ramblas. Walked quickly in day light and used cabs in the evening. Wouldn't waste time and money on the cafes/restaurants immediately outside the hotel. Pizza bar had a limited menu only one meat pizza available and we couldn't eat the food served at one of the cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Get Me Outta Heree!”
Reviews.Author: barcie879
Reviews.Content: OK!, The Hotel Raval is fine; it is clean and the staff is friendly, but the rooms are almost inconveniently modern: like figuring out how to work the shower could take ten minutes. Also the futuristic lighting tacky decor of the lobby and room makes me think I'm in Ariel's garden from "The Little Mermaid" . The surrounding 'barrio' is claimed to be up-and-coming...well I'll take your word for it and come back in fifteen years when the prostitutes and drug dealers no longer roam the perimeter of the hotel. The reviews say the hotel is located in the heart of the city near the hottest shops and restaurants and well as cultural attractions, but in reality they are all at least a 15 minute walk away. Which is fine if you don't mind passing little 'nino' holding a toy? gat. The walk would actually be fine....if I brought a rottweiler for the journey between hotel and destination, and making the walk at night...I guess just cross your fingers. In hinds sight...Get Me Outta Here!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, wrong location!”
Reviews.Author: Whiska
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 other friends (all men) to celebrate my 50th birthday. The hotel was stunning, modern, comfortable rooms, great views, had a free upgrade, but.....unfortunately built in the completely wrong area! Not only it was near the red light district but it was actually risky walking around during the day, could not, would not venture out at night, and that was 4 burly men! One of our friends was robbed of his wallet and we all had near misses with what can only be described as macigician pickpockets! Definitely not a place for families, if you do go, watch your back, keep your hand on wallet and be prepared to run fast!

Reviews.Title: “Funky awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: chimp8680
Reviews.Content: I don't think I need to go on too much about this hotel. It's awesome. Very centrally located, gorgeous lounge/bar, well designed funky rooms and the rooftop bar/pool area is great during both the day & night (it made the perfect place for my proposal). All in all it was great & made my engagement weekend that little bit more special

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient, clean, modern, great service. Why would you want more?”
Reviews.Author: Beccy08
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barcelo Raval in the middle of the day. We were immediately checked in by members of staff with excellent English. They also were fluent in French. We were offered a smoking or non smoking room. As we were early our room wasn't available but we were offered a suitable alternative. We were shown to our room which was very funky and very modern. We immediately went to see the roof terrace and were astounded by the views! It was then I realised I had left my camera in the taxi! The staff couldn't have been more helpful and rang the taxi company and kept us informed of any progress. The room was cleaned daily, not just a change of towels and bed made but actually cleaned! Breakfast was substantial, with a healthy and not so healthy option! There is a small health suite, and sauna which was lovely after a day of walking. The 'outdoor pool' is more like a splash pool, but I can imagine on a hot summers day it would be perfect to dip weary feet into. The hotel is really close to the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas, as other reviews say depending which way you turn out of the hotel you will experience a very different walk to Las Ramblas! But we didnt have a problem even though we did opt for the more 'interesting' walk to Las Ramblas! But as with anywhere have your wits about you, and as a girl I wouldn't walk alone, but that is just common sense! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to friends without a moments hesitation. We booked through our Tesco vouchers and I can't believe we could stay someone like this using Tesco rewards!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, we have no complaints”
Reviews.Author: 22179vic
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights staying at the Barcelo Raval with my husband for his 40th Birthday. I economically used my Tesco vouchers, therefore didn't cost me a penny!! However I would have happily paid as our experience was excellent. Unfortunately my map reading was not the best do by the time my husband took over we ended up taking a shortcut through the red-light district. This was not particularly comfortable but we there was a strong police presence so we were not overly concerned. Once we stepped into the hotel we were happy, it looks stunning. We were allocated a room on the 3rd floor but on arrived although the room was lovely it was a side view of a building and not particularly great. I called reception to see if they had any rooms facing the street available and straight away the receptionist said yes. We then had room 502 on the 5th floor. It was lovely and had a view up and down the Rambla del Raval. The room had an enormous bed, was greatly styled although probably best to share with your partner than just a friend, as there is not much privacy when showering etc! We didn't book to have breakfast but found Starbucks on Las Ramblas convenient and also across the road from the hotel is 'Fish & Chips' that does cooked breakfasts for about €8 from 10.30 am. We found lots of good places to eat in the evenings around Las Ramblas, the best place being in the square off Las Ramblas. Turn right once onto Las Ramblas from Carrer Hospital, then take the left road where NcDonalds and KFC is, just on the right hand side is an entrance to the square which has lots if lovely restaurants. There is so much to see in Barcelona I think we must have walked about 10 miles a day, so take comfy shoes! We also did the open top bus which was good value, we dud the Olympic Stadium and Nou Camp on this. Overall a great holiday which was made all the better for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: hazy_amersham
Reviews.Content: A short stay at this hotel is a good choice for a Barcelona city break. Modern and as you would expect clean and well maintained. Most of the staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel restaurant offers good food well cooked and served - wine list by UK standard not too pricey! Get a room as high as you can (6th floor +) to get the best value from the floor to ceiling windows. The footprint of the hotel is an ellipse so if you can get a room at either apex you have a quirky room layout but a view across more of the city, the Rambla side is best. The location in a lower-class district, just by the still active, red light area is not appealing but is an easy walk (in day time!) to La Rambla and old town sights. Very evident police presence at night in the Rambla Raval. There is a taxi rank right by hotel entrance and 120 local bus goes by too. (Taxl fare to BCN T1 €35.) Big -ve for snotty receptionist who couldn't recommend a good local restaurant, big +ve for security guard who could! Take his advice and book for Casa Leonado 20 meters across the road! A sign by the rooftop swimming pool warns you that it is 1 metre deep but since it is only 1 metre wide by 3 long seems rather redundant!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: ronneyroon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona. The location of this hotel is very central and close to most things, however it is in the middle of the red light district! It can be a bit daunting when walking to the centre, passing all the sights. The hotel itself is ultra modern and trendy, with a dark reception area flecked with bright vibrant colours. Our room was a double and was a decent size. The views were good, although much better from the 360 viewing space at the top of the hotel. Much of our view consisted of looking at the local accomdoation across the street! The shower cubicle is in the centre of the room and it is supurb! Very large, room for more than 2 people! It is powerful and probably the best shower ive had. Although the layout of the room was trndy and modern, it left a lot to be desired. There were few plug sockets where you actually needed them, and this caused the room to be entangled with wires when one of us was ironing and the other doing hair. There is one central surface in the room, which is where the sink is and this is also cluttered with a coffee machine, and toilettries. This is the area where the hair dryer is and main lit mirror and this fast became a nightmare, with lotions and potions falling all over the place. The lighting in the room was quite poor as well. It was flecked with funky pink strip lighting around the bed, and lights aroun the mirror, but the room was quite dark. Ventilation and the air conditioning was also poor. The air con would only go to 17 and the room was boiling during the night. Would have loved to have been able to open the window, but the doors coul not be opened, and in the morning they would be fully steamed up. There was no extractor fan from the toilet and shower area, and again this caused the room to be hot and steamy. There was a tv and ipod docking station/radio in the bedroom, and although our coffee machine leaked everywhere it was a great idea and far better than having to boil a kettle. Breakfast was fantastic, with plenty of choice, from fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereal to cooked bacon and sausages and lush scrambled egg. The breakfast staff were great too, very accomodating and friendly. These were really the only members of staff we came across, other than another male who i assume is the hotel security, he appeared to be grumpy and gave funny looks whilst we spent time taking photos in the intersting lobby with the life size pig and horse.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan meets Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: indianniem
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this very WOW hotel! Loved the New York uber-stylish look. It is soo cool & funky. Rooms are very trendy & comfy beds...great 360 degree views of Barcelona from the top floor bar. Food in restaurant was very good & breakfast was great too. Walking distance to the Ramblas. It was perfect choice for a chilled weekend in a great city. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “cool, small and very hot”
Reviews.Author: MikeFMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A very hip hotel. Rooms are cool but small. It was a challenge to sleep each night as the rooms are very hot and when you turn the AC on its loud enough to keep you awake. Otherwise the hotel represents good value and and is in a good location, close enough to Las Ramblas without being on top of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel, perfect for our group of young professionals.”
Reviews.Author: Beansley
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we used this hotel for our small event and we were impressed with it. On the lead up to our event the hotel the staff were very co-operative and quick to respond to my enquiries. The meeting space had natural light, which was great, and suited our needs. We liked the design of the hotel and the bedrooms were very clean and modern. I was on the 9th floor and had great views of the city and I loved the floor to ceiling windows and the electric curtains. I also loved the fact there was free WiFi all over the hotel which actually worked really well and was of a decent speed. I logged on when I first arrived and my connection remained for the duration of my stay at the hotel which was 4 nights - I didn't have to log on again at all. Good WiFi is important to our group. The breakfast selection was good at the hotel and the food was replenished regularly throught the morning. We also had a small drinks reception at the hotel, coffee breaks and lunches and all were great. The food was tasty and the service was good although we maybe should have allowed longer for our lunch breaks as 1 hour was not enough for a 3 course lunch. I agree with some of the other comments about the noise levels and the area. On the first night I did not go out alone as I felt a little nervous about walking through the adjoining streets to reach La Ramblas, due to what I had heard about drug dealers and prostitutes. When we went out on a night as a group I felt perfectly safe and did not really see any evidence of the drugs or prostitution, but then I wasn't looking for it! The noise on an evening was quite loud and I was on the 9th floor. Also the soundproofing between rooms was not good and I was rudely awoken early one morning to sounds from next door which I would rather not have heard!!!! I also had to laugh at the "pool" on the roof which I mistook for a water feature until I had walked right around the roof and not found what I would class as a pool (fantastic 360 degree views from the roof by the way - loved the fact there were also binoculars and also pictures of the most interesting buildings on the glass barriers, saying what they were). Overall I really liked this hotel. The staff were professional, helpful and friendly and the modern design was perfect for our group. I would certainly recommend using it again for our event.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: souzou
Reviews.Content: For the price, Barcelo Raval was a real let-down for us. The hotel claims to have parking "in the same building" but what they neglect to mention is that it is a public car park beneath their building that charges 34 euros a day. When we arrived and found this out the staff were not apologetic at all and blamed the Expedia listing (who we had booked through) for being wrong, saying parking is not mentioned on their website (sorry but it is on barcelo.com). But, "as it was a national holiday" (6th jan), they agreed to upgrade our room to a deluxe for free - which would have otherwise cost us 30euros. Hmm. So on to the room, the design of which uses modern styling to try and hide the fact that it is essentially very small. The shower was opposite the wardrobe so getting dressed often meant wet feet/socks, and the "desk" was just about big enough to put a laptop on, but certainly not comfortable enough to work at for any period of time. The heating system did not seem to work properly - you could set the thermostat temperature but turning the system on just led to blasts of cold air from the noisy fans. Worst still was that after removing the card key and leaving the room the system would turn on automatically so that whenever we came back our room was freezing (even if we set the thermostat to 30 degrees!). Great in summer I imagine, but not in winter. You also can't open any windows if you want any fresh air. The bed was a good size and comfortable, but we didn't sleep too well as there was a lot of noise from outside - typical of the area I guess. Pros: - Good location for getting around Barcelona - 360-degree panoramic views from the roof are amazing - Fast, free wi-fi Cons: - Dodgy temperature control system - Small rooms - Car park charges - Noisy area if you like to go to bed early

Reviews.Title: “Trendy looking hotel in decent area”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNTravels74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night before leaving Barcelona and weren't overly impressed with the area around the hotel as it is a bit shady. The hotel itself is high on design and quirkiness with friendly front desk staff. The room was a decent size but a king bed was two beds made up separately and pushed together. I did get a great nights sleep (not the most romantic) but it could have been all of the red wine. The bathroom does lack privacy and the hotel does feel a bit like something from the Jetsons but it makes for fun photos and the price is decent. Not a bad hotel but would not be my first choice when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful sleep experience”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: Having to travel a lot, I am not really picky about hotels getting into little details. Good sleep makes me happy in 99% of the cases. I was very unhappy after 2 nights of this hotel, because: - first of all, I am not really a fan of funky design. However, when the room is comfortable, it doesn't really matter. This room was very uncomfortable. Even though it looked spacious, it really wasn't. No space for luggage next to the wardrobe. The minute you walk in you bump into the bed. - i got my room on the second floor facing the rambla. gosh, till 3 am I felt like my bed was in the middle of the square - I could hear people on the other side of the street, cars, shouting. It was just aweful. It was a weekday, by the way. - The floor in the room is tiled and it is extremely cold. I literally had to step on my bathroom rag and move with it around the room. - The bed is the wost part of it. It is not really a double bed, but two single beds on the wheels without stoppers. I had to push the bed to a bedtime table, so it won't move. Of course, no moving around the bed was possible. - Soundproof was really bad. Maybe it wasn't just about the walls, but positioning of the bed right at the door. - Area. I love Barcelona, but Raval seems to be not the nicest place of the downtown. Hash smell is all around the square by 6 pm, people hanging around clearly can sell you anything you want, prostitutes on every corner. I'm fine with that stuff in general, but this is the not the place where I would stay with children. Good thing - free Wi-Fi which you rarely see nowadays in the 4 and 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyGNCFC
Reviews.Content: hotel is just off Las Ramblas and so in a good location. Reception nicely designed and staff extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms are fantastic - very modern, chic and stylish. Breakfast buffet preety good with excellent quality items and plenty of choice. We were "stuck" here during the Icelandic volcano eruption and the staff were really helpful in trying to find us a route home and the manager did not try to exploit the situation which was comendable. Overall an excellent hotel with very friendly and professional staff much in line with other Barcelo hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Modern landmark hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emyr_Elen
Reviews.Content: First impressions: the space-age Barceló Raval stands out amongst the crowded residential Raval area. Inside, the modern theme continues with an open plan layout - the shower is right next to the bed! It might sound a bit odd, but it works well! We had a very peaceful night's sleep. No street noise and the black-out curtains (electrically operated!) keep out the light which would otherwise be streaming-in through the huge windows. Our room was spotlessly clean. Nice touches include the Nespresso machine for great coffees and the large flat-screen TV with 60+ channels. We didn't eat there (the breakfast seemed ridiculously expensive!) so we can't comment - but there are plenty of places to eat within a short walking distance. Some of the scare-stories about the area had slightly concerned us. However, despite walking the area each night, we didn't feel at all threatened. Granted, we didn't walk down some of the very narrow alleys but we certainly found no problems with Carrer del Carme, Carrer de l'Hospital and Rambla del Raval.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecpc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed for sight-seeing, however the location as such is a little seedy and run down. Having said that the hotel is immaculately clean and very funky! The bedroom has electric curtains and a coffee making machine which is a nice touch. We did not eat in the hotel there are many restaurants and bars in the area to explore. Barcelona is a great place for a city break and we would certainly stay at the hotel again. The roof terrace has stunning views and is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!! take it if you want to sleep like a baby...”
Reviews.Author: micmic84
Reviews.Content: first, we booked at "getaroom.com"- you can get a very good price! the staff was very helpful and kind. the area is not so nice after 9 p.m. and you better walk only on the main st.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan to read in your room”
Reviews.Author: LPTexasusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very hip in decor, including the rooms, with pink lights outlining the headboards. The space is minimal for a not-large couple. Plus sizes should look elsewhere, as should anyone who wants to read a book or even look at a map. The only place with enough light to do either is in the WC! Front desk staff was nice but not knowlegeable. The two restaurants they directed us to were mediocre and I think had dropped off cards with maps so they would get referrals. We are here for six nights and but for the fact we are meeting friends here, we would move elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatnOlly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, without breakfast. Booked it through Spanish tourist office online. Was expensive (for me) but over a weekend, and for a new 4 star hotel very worthwhile. Bed was enormous! Shower and toilet funky, TV, lights, etc all cool. One tip - buy your own drinking water! The tap water is unpleasant (though potable) and the mini bar water is shipped in from FIJI and costs €6! The only complaint I have! Reception people friendly and helpful though we didn't use them except for check in and out. Rooms are amazing and very funky. We asked for a view and got 9th floor - great. Too cold to sit in pool for sunset but enjoyed the panarama, used the sauna and left our bags during the last day of our stay in the locked up room next to reception. The area is not so nice and we did the "prostitute gauntlet" every night coming back from La Rambla but there was no trouble and we even saw police hanging around quite a bit. That's not their fault though as they are obviously trying to improve the area. Just be careful, stick to lit streets and walk quickly and confidently! But then, we live in London so we weren't that bothered. Otherwise really excellent location for getting about - we used the metro a few times and walked everywhere else. There is a safe in the room so we left anythign remotely valuable there and took whatever we needed out. Simple! Everything about the hotel was new and great. We enjoyed it and it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Barcelo Raval”
Reviews.Author: Carrie84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelo Raval for four nights after a trip to the Bennicassim Festival - we booked through Easytobook.com & got a great rate of little over £300 for for a superior double room for 4 nights stay. We were on the 7th floor. What we were looking for was somewhere to recover from the festival antics, be comfortable & relaxed in stylish surroundings and be in a good location to explore the city - the Barcelo Raval delivered on everything we wanted. The rooms are spotlessly clean, the beds are super comfy and you get plenty of pillows & duvets. The shower - although probably not everyone's taste - is a glass box in the middle of the room! It has a giant rain style head, really powerful and we never had any problems with water temperature at any time of the day. You get a coffee machine in your room which is a lovely touch & there is a mini bar (although as expected it's very expensive). The rooms were cleaned everyday & if you needed new towels these were provided. We ate at the hotel restaurant once and i must say it was really tasty - but quite expensive. We also used the room service once for a few tapas items & found that to be good but also again quite expensive. The best thing about this hotel undoubtedly is the roof top. We spent every evening after a day of sightseeing sitting up there having a cocktail (10 euros) or a few glass of Cava (4 Euros) until the sun went down. It's a 360 degree roof terrace so you can see all across Barcelona - beautiful! There is a small pool on the roof, not great for swimming but perfect for a quick dip to cool off. We didn't use the pool as we were too busy exploring the city. There is also sun loungers on the roof. I really liked the area that the hotel was in, it was lovely walking through the lanes in the day & going to the fruit market in the morning. It's so central and close to La Ramblas. However, it goes without saying that you need to keep your wits about you after dark. We later found out that a guy we met at the festival was mugged at knife point & had his passport stolen very close to the hotel one evening. Pickpocketing is also rife in the area & Barcelona in general really, shop keepers, hotel staff & taxi drivers were always kindly reminding you to watch your bags. The safest & simple thing to do is jump in a taxi to & from the hotel at night...it's no problem to do, there is always taxis in the square or the hotel reception will call you one and when you get home in the evening there is always someone on the door of the hotel to escort you in. Every taxi driver we used knew the hotel, if your Spanish, like ours is not great, we found that just giving taxi drivers the business card to the hotel worked and we never had any problems. We plan to go back to Barcelona, and when we do we will definitely stay at the Barcelo Raval.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, DISAPPOINTING BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: welltravelledNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 27-29th October for joint 40th birthday celebrations in a junior suite on 10th floor. Lovely views of the city. Bed was the most comfortable bed ever, wanted to bring it home. Breakfast was disappointing - nice selection of fruit, pastries, juices, toast jam etc. Had a very small selection of English breakfast which included sausages, bacon, scrambled egg, potatoes which was all COLD. We had booked this in with room price and was very disappointed and wished we had done room only. there was a cafe across the Raval Rambla square which did cooked english breakfast for only 7Euros which looked lovely. We had one evening meal in the hotel which was ok, not too expensive and tasty. On the second evening went to a restaurant on Rambla Raval called BARRAVAL which we would Highly recommend - (Walk out of hotel, look right in the corner with Black Sunshades over windows). Food excellent, reasonably priced, great service - a thoroughly enjoyable evening. Where to walk - We came out of the hotel - turned right to the end and down Hospital Road to get to Las Ramblas (max 5 mins) and never felt intimidated, there are a lot of people hanging around but no problem. However - if you walk out of the hotel and turn left, to the end then left again to Las Ramblas - Not pleasant, red light district and lots of unsavory characters. Although we had no problems on the one occassion we walked this way, just felt pretty uncomfortable. All in all a lovely stay, great location, would recommend but not the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, loved it...”
Reviews.Author: jax_1968
Reviews.Content: Yep, great for couples, it's all very compact...and quite an 'experience'.... Highlights: the most comfortable beds of anywhere I've stayed, roof top bar (no real pool to speak of), but you can get wet. Shower fantastic. Free wi-fi, great design in the whole hotel (takes a bit to guess how to get things to work in the hotel, but that's fun). Great staff. LOVED the area. Away from tourist ville. I fear this will change though and this hotel will unfortunately contribute to that... lowlights: Mauve lighting over the bed hideous, but you can turn that off.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: telerijj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barcelo Raval between 17th - 21st October and using our Tesco Clubcard vouchers as payment, so helped with making a trip to Barcelona affordable. Both of us were happy with the hotel - very trendy interior design, queen size bed, mood lighting, wifi, electric curtains, coffee making machine. Staying here for a weekend is fine but by the end of the stay, we had enough of the dim / coloured lights in the room and lobby. Rooftop bar is great - fantastic views from here and the bar faced south so can catch some sun in the evning while having a drink. The swimming pool is more like a paddling pool and it's not heated. We didn't use it but if you were staying in Barcelona in the hot summer, i think you'd appriciate a cold dip to cool down. Breakfast was ok, plenty of choice of fruit, coat meats, cheese, bread, pastries and fruit juice. Hot 'English' breakfast was ok but if I was to stay here again, I would have opted to have room only rather than B&B. 22 euro is a LOT for breakfast where there are plenty of little cafes around the Raval de Ramblas open early in the morning for a coffee and pasty for 6 euro. Staff were good at the hotel but the kitchen staff could be better - friendly staff at reception, fast check in and very helpful in getting a doctor for us as my boyfriend had food poisoning (stay away from the Taller de Tapas restaurants). However, the kitchen staff could have been a bit more helpful as we asked for some plain rice (doctors orders) but couldn't prepare any for us. Also, no low fat milk or yogurt at brekfast time. So I do question if they prepare food there from scrtach or is all ready meals. Location of the hotel is brilliant, very central and easy to get from Liceu stop. However, we prefered using the Paral.lel stop as we found the walk there faster and more pleasent. The hotel is located in a multicultural area of Barcelona so the locals are mostly Asian/Arabian. Plenty of bars and cafes in the Raval de Ramblas so don't have to venture far from the hotel for something to eat or drink in the evening. We went to Bar Raval for three nights as we loved the chilled out atmosphere there and great tapas. We didn't have an issue about the streets in the area and not entirely sure where the red light district is here. We walked down Carrer de l'hospital and Carrer de Sant Paul to get to the metro and didn't feel uneasy or get hassled by the locals. Overall, we enjoyed the stay and we would return (using our Tesco Clubcard vouchers of course!)

Reviews.Title: “Be careful which way you walk to the centre from the hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: julestf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and has all the little touches that make it a very modern hotel like the lights in the floor showing the room number - the 360 degree viewing level on the top is a must have - see the sights from the hotel and it gives you an idea how far you are from them to plan your visit! The rooms are amazing - very plush and huge beds - very comfortable! I would definitely recommend understanding the position of the hotel with regards to the dodgy areas - to get from the hotel to the main street Las Ramblas, depending on which way you turn out of the hotel, you can walk right into the red light district which we did on the first afternoon :( Not the best experience on the first day of our honeymoon! But being in very close distance to Las Ramblas (walking there in 10 mins) and also to the port (walking there in 30 mins) is a definate bonus for those stopping off before going on a cruise Overall an amazing hotel - would definitely stay again and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alliei80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel using Tesco Clubcard vouchers to subsidise the trip. First thing to note, if you are carrying lots of luggage do take a cab on arrival (either direct from airport or from Placa Catalunya where the airport bus drops you) as although the walk from Placa Cataluyna is very short with luggage we quickly became rather hot!! However that aside the location is excellent, less than 5 minutes walk from Las Rambles but fair enough away that you're not quite in the constant hussle and bussle. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted with a smile and checked in quickly and efficiently. We were also given a map of the local area and shown the routes to walk if we wanted to avoid the nearby red light area. We did in fact walk through that area one early evening but were not given any hassle, although women alone may find it slightly intimidating. However I found the location superb, we were right on the square of Raval so easy access to an early evening or late night drink. Our room was very modern and clean with lots of nice goodies - coffee machine, well-stocked mini bar and a nice selection of complementary toiletries. The bathroom/toilet set up is slightly unusual and probably not well suited to non-couples or those who are a little on the prudish side! However, we had no issues with this and the shower was really good. The beds were also very comfortable, although was a shame it was two twins rather than a double. The curtains were electronic (button by the bed) and blocked out the light excellently. We didn't try the food in the hotel - too many other places to visit - but we did have a few drinks on the rooftop bar, which was a lovely place to enjoy a glass of cava whilst the sun sets. Beware it does get very busy in the evening and so the queue does mean waiting sometimes, also they don;t sell bottles of wine/cava, which is a shame as it would mean less need to queue again. The pool is teeny - not large enough to swim in but a good spot to cool off. My boyfriend said the gym was well equipped and very quiet. We paid for a late checkout but this was only until 3pm, which seemed a bit early given the charge (20 Euros from memory) and a few more hours would have been appreciated. The general ambience of the hotel was very cool and funky, the location excellent, the staff polite and helpful, the room more than adequate and I would definitely return. If you do visit be sure to make the effort to visit nearby Las Fernández on C/Carretas , a restaurant run by three sisters, it was the best meal I ate in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Scary location and the hotel views are great.”
Reviews.Author: hellofalady
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after using our Tesco vouchers to subsidise the trip. At reception we got a free upgrade as the hotel was fully occupied so a great start. The room was excellent and overlooked the the Raval Ramblas which is lively until about 2.00am. Rooms was modern, funky and the shower was great and the bed was so comfy. There is a small dipping pool on the roof of the hotel with 360 degree views and a cocktail bar in the evening - only a couple of sun loungers for the day so if you are relaxing that day be early to lay down your towel. Food in the hotel was expensive 22 euro for breakfast whilst we stayed there per person but we ate in the Spanish cafe on the Hospital Road that leads down to Las Ramblas from the menu del dia for 6.50 euros each for 3 courses they don't speak english but have a few menus in english and if you like authentic rustic spanish food then go - and yes I have forgotten the name. (Walk out of the Raval hotel turn to your right and go to the corner of the Raval Ramblas and head down the little street with the supermarket/shop and it's down on the right with a yellow and black sign over the door. The Raval Ramblas is very pleasant to sit and eat and drink on and much cheaper than the actual Las Ramblas 5 mins walk away. Average price in euro Wine 2.80 per glass and Vodka and Coke 6.00 euro or if your lucky they do buy one get one free at certain times of the day. The red light district and scary men that everyone talked about is to the left of the hotel but down one street and we walked up and down without a problem or seeing anyone menancing at all - there is a lot of police in cars and walking about all over and we never saw or heard of anything untoward for the 3 days we were there. The washing down of the streets happens everyday to clean up from the night before and not for any sinister reasons. I would go back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: eh999
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending 3 nights at the Barcelo Raval and had a really great time. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are decorated in a really trendy style. They are quite small but were absolutely fine for our short stay and the big shower was amazing! The hotel has a great rooftop terrace where you can watch the sunset and get a gorgeous view over Barcelona - in the evenings a small bar operates up there too. Cocktails are pretty expensive but beer is cheaper and the view is worth it. There is also a bar and restaurant on the ground floor that seems popular with the locals of an evening. We didn't have any problems with the area, you just have to be sensible. The two main streets leading to La Rambla are fine to walk down (just watch out for the red light district to the south!) and the actual Rambla de Raval where the hotel is based is a nice pedestrian area. We ate at some of the local restaurants and had some really good food and also visited a couple of the bars and the people were friendly enough. The staff in the hotel were all pleasant to deal with and mostly they speak English for anyone who is not very good with Spanish. We didn't eat dinner in the hotel but the breakfast was good so I imagine the evening food is comparable. We used Tesco Clubcard vouchers to pay for the stay so I'm not sure how good a value it is normally but I would certainly do the same thing again.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, exciting district, in one of the worlds best cities”
Reviews.Author: nickfear
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've been a regular visitor to Barcelona. I've grown to like the Raval, the district where this hotel is located, and on previous visits watched as this hotel was developed so I was keen to stay there. I wasn't disappointed at all - I would say this is the best chain hotel I've stayed in Barcelona. It could probably be described as a design hotel - the building itself is an unusual piece of modern architecture, the rooms and public areas certainly have interesting decor. I'm not generally a fan of this type of design - but nothing here is unpleasant and nothing detracts from comfort. Whilst not enormous the room itself was very comfortable. Large comfortable bed with good linen, excellent shower, flat screen tv, reliable fast wifi and two really useful more unusual features - the iPod dock and the Nespresso machine. The rooftop bar has wonderful 360 degree views of the city and is a pleasant place for a sunset drink. I can't comment on any further food or drink, as even for breakfast I always go out in Barcelona - there are so many great places to go (try Bar Kasparo for breakfast) Staff in this hotel were friendly and helpful. The hotel is not cheap, but few hotels in Barcelona are, and this is certainly comparable with others for what you get. As a district some people will be put off by the Raval. But I find its mix of traditional working class, Asian immigrants, red-light district, artists and young professionals quite exciting, a place of real character. The Rambla de Raval, where the hotel is, is one of the great streets of the city even if only 10 years old. More and more tourists are discovering the Raval too, though its still a world away from the main tourist places (even though only a 5 minute walk from the Ramblas) You need to be careful walking around any area in Barcelona, including this one. But remember most crime against tourists happens in the tourist hotspots, particularly the Ramblas. Don't be put off by the stories you hear about crime, I've been to Barcelona over 10 times and luckliy to date have never been a victim. Just enjoy one of the greatest cities in the world, and this hotel would be a good base to start.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - don't be put off by the area!”
Reviews.Author: at_567
Reviews.Content: This is a really stylish hotel and great value if you find a good deal. Yes, the area isn't full of big chained hotels, but is only 5-minute walk to the ramblas and the area just to the north of the square is really cool. I was worried about the mention of red light district, but this street can easily be avoided - so don't let this put you off! One downside was that the shower is very exposed, so not ideal if you're sharing a room with someone that isn't your other half!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: banditManchester
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful, the hotel wonderful, the location perhaps not the most attractive in the City but the hotel view of the city from the roof bar is wonderful as was the thunderstorm that we watched from the 360degree barw was very very good. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Scary Back Alley!”
Reviews.Author: K-Rock2425
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty sweet in appearance and we were excited to stay here before we arrived. Unfortunately the final leg of our honeymoon trip is not ending on the most romantic note. Pretty much this hotel is smack dab in the middle of tourist-ville (AKA Las Ramblas) and slum city. Our first afternoon here we mistakenly took a right after exiting our hotel and ended up on hooker row. No joke, I would say there were easily between 10-20 hookers in the alley right behind our hotel. These hookers continue to line the streets for several blocks along with some shady characters who gave us both the spine chilling creeps. Needless to say, we don't feel safe here and feel even more uncomfortable at night. Also, this morning we had the pleasure to wake up to police, ambulances and firetrucks outside our window and the street was being hosed down. The hotel is also lacking some sound-proofing. We can hear ever word being said outside from seven floors up as well as from room to room and in the halls. The cleaning crew moves the metal bed frames on the tile floors when they clean which makes a loud screeching sound that is impossible to sleep through. Another thing that could be improved is the customer service. We bought a couple bottles of wine and called down to see if they could bring up a corkscrew and a bucket of ice. They told us we had to come down and get it from the restaurant. When we came down to get it they told us they don't have corkscrews to loan out or buckets of ice. Then the guy (who was very nice) looked around and found us a corkscrew that was left behind by another patron. It was filthy and we had to wash it off in our room with bar soap. We appreciated his friendly attitude and willingness to try to help us but really a hotel this price should have one of those cheap corkscrews for the room and a bucket for ice. On a good note: the beds are super comfortable, the door men are very polite and helped me out of the taxi, the deluxe room is good sized, breakfast is decent, the hotel is very clean, he decor is modern, and the hotel's close walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: HCeciLichfield
Reviews.Content: We have celebrated my husban's 40th this weekend with a group of 10 friends, and we are all entusiastic of our stay, very memorable!The Barcelo Raval Hotel made this special weekend even extra-special. Nothing to add, just stay there to enjoy the non-obvious. Despite the post modern architectural and furnishing style, caring and professional staff with an impeccable cleaness were just the icing on the cake. Tip: curtains open electronically, push the button!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly funky!”
Reviews.Author: SmirkingPixie
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband and friends over the bank holiday weekend. Location really good and felt pretty safe despite some of the comments. One of the refuse collectors actually warned my friend about keeping a close eye on her handbag but we didn't experience any problems at all. Rooms are slightly small but perfect for a couple of nights (we were in the cheapest). Odd experience having the basin, loo, shower so close and may put people off sharing a room with, say, a parent. Mood lighting is not great for make up but wonderful for blurring those imperfections after a long evening !! Lovely breakfasts and the rooftop bar is wonderful in the evening - gives a panoramic view of the city. Drinks are not hideously expensive but beware of Walkers Crisps costing equivalent of £4.50. All in all, give it a whirl, you won't be disappointed and its much quieter than the hotels nearer Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “New, stylish, comfortable, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NAAAT
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, it's really fantastic! The hotel is very well situated: just 5 minutes on foot from Rambla and Mercat de la Boqueria; 10 minutes from plaça de Catalunya and from Columbus Monument. Also you can easily come to Barcelonetta and Eixample. I think the streets around the hotel are neither terryfing nor dangerous. A lot of tourists walked there day and night. Those, who wrote about scary surroundings probably didn’t visit Barry Gothic or Barcelonetta – it’s really uncomfortable to appear there at night. The hotel is very nice. Every detail in it is in line with its style. Design is outstanding and comfortable! Superior room is not big, but cozy. Twin bed is comfortable and rather steady. The shower is very nice: it’s spacious and pleasant to be used. The wardrobe can contain enough clothes. I liked the cosmetic mirror. Nespresso café machine makes wonderful coffee. The light in the room live its own life but we were able to deal with it. Unfortunately our room was on the 3 floor, so the view from the room was not fantastic (on the neighboring building). Top roof bar is an interesting place for seeing the city, but the hotel is not very high. The personnel of the hotel is polite and friendly. Breakfast in the hotel is very good. Croissants are over any sorts of praise. There is a free Wi-Fi internet in rooms and in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: We stayed here soon after it opened, but I felt compelled to review it now as I was so impressed at the time. We spent 3 nights here with out toddler and had a wonderful time, and would recommend it to anyone who we thought would appreciat the edgy design and area. Granted the location has been a bit dodgy in the past, but we walked around a lot at night with our daughter and never once felt unsafe,although obviously as in any city, we kept our wits about us. It is perfectly situated for the main attractions in Barcelona, minutes from the Ramblas, and near to the train station. I actually quite liked the character of the area because it was such a contrast to the touristy Ramblas. The rooms are fantastic althoughit took me a while to work out how to open thecurtains! The breakfast buffet was superb and hot food cooked to order. We found the staff to be very helpful and polite and they were particularly nice to our little girl,letting her sit on the life size horse sculpture in the reception area! We would definitely stay here again. tion

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in spite the neighborhood..”
Reviews.Author: Karlla
Reviews.Content: You have to take care and do not go behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewG001
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Tesco clubcard vouchers and found it friendly and quite well situated just a short walk from the Rambla but not any main tourist routes. The decor was uber-funky and our 19-year old twins loved it. Beds and rooms were very comfortable indeed. Only stayed one night, but it was well worth it as an introduction to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the 'tourists' who are from suburbia”
Reviews.Author: votel
Reviews.Content: Right, it all depends what you're looking for in a holiday. If you're an unadventurous tourist from suburbia, stick to the tacky Ramblas that's full of tourists from all over the globe but gives you no idea of the true (beautiful and funky) Barcelona. If you love cities, art, culture and want to experinece the real cool Barcelona, the Raval is the place. I love it! And please stupid tourists, yes Barcelona has pick pockets like every other major city in the world. But please don't wonder around like the Yanks I see clutching onto your backpacks for dear life and screaming every time they're approached. Really bad manners. 99% of people who live in Barcelona are genuine hard working people who have no interest in your vile Kmart rucksack.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel great central location”
Reviews.Author: mumruthAyrScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my two teenage sons stayed for one night in this lovely hotel. We loved the quirky modern decor. Everywhere you looked there was something interesting to look at. The rooms were well appointed spotlessly clean and my teenagers especially liked all the gadgets. The staff were polite efficient and very helpful even making a phone call for us and then translating it.Breakfast was excellent and i can't think of anything they would possibly want to add to it. The food was avery high standard and the presentation was immaculate. we will definately use this hotel again and i would definately reccommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Claire-Clinton
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel located near Las Ramblas. The rooms are a good size and the beds are very large. There is a nespresso machine in the room which was a nice touch. The roof terrace is lovely and there is free internet in the lobby. There are lots of restaurants nearby that serve good food.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: BryanM_Derby
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel with good clean rooms - although very odd shaped rooms due to the shape of the building. Breakfast service very good, bar service in the evenings very slow and very expensive. However... Be aware, this is a very rough area and whilst I was there I had my bag snatched from in front of me whilst sitting in reception as I was about to leave. Barcelona is notorious for petty crime, but hotels such as this, which are not cheap, should have better security on the entrances. It's the old part of town so the thief was gone into the myriad of alleyways within seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious, great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SN11
Reviews.Content: I went with my mom for 2 nights. We reached the lobby and gave us a good impression. We had problems with the booking but the hotel staff member reassured us and it was fixed within 10 minutes. There were also two iMacs for free use. I had no laptop, but a phone with WiFi, only it did not connect because he could not get an IP address. Once in our room, the luxury exudes from it. Nice shower and sink, all things design. The curtains can be opened with a control on the side of the bed. I think the idea of the bathroom (wc) door is also very nice designed. The important thing was that it was very clean. When cleaning, I came inside and saw the girl, even scrubbing the shower. The only flaw I found that the LEDs above the bed can not turn off, only if you turn off all lights and want to sleep in complete darkness. The fitness centre was also very nice. What I recommend to everyone, is to visit the 360 degrees terrace. The view is very beautiful, and you can relax there (benches and a bar) One evening we had dinner at the restaurant of the hotel, it was delicious. The price was high, but that's to be expected. My mother also enjoyed the Nespresso, and I enjoyed the Ipod dock. Before I was booking this hotel, I read many reviews on the negative points about the neighborhood. It turnt out better than expected. The hotel employee gave us a map (nice of her) and showed us the path we must not take in the evening (Carrer l'Hospital) but we had to walk through Carrer del Carme. We have taken this road every day, even during the day, and totally not bothered by annoying people, as you would expect, two women who walks alone.
