It is near Las Ramblas, approximately 5 minutes walk. So good location. The Aerobus station is 10 minutes walk to the hotel(Placa Catalunya). Also, we were warned many many pickpockets are. When you wear a shoulder bag and wear it in front of yourself, and not lose sight of it, it will be ok. So we had very nice time at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Jai Ho Barca”
Reviews.Author: ele203
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Raval Hotel is a very hotel to stay. the time i went it was a relatively new hotel. Very comfortable rooms, clean, nice bathrooms. Room walls a little thin, in the quite of the night the adjoining room mates can hear you if he hears a little closely. Besides this, the breakfast is fantastic with a very good spread. The staff very courteous and helpful. Barcelona is a small city. Travelling by metro is best. La Ramla is a couple of metro stops from hotel. La Ramla best place to spend your time and one of the most happening place. You can enjoy the mimic artist, dances, singing groups or sit down with one of the artist and do your potrait. Europe is nice cause you can hire a Bicycle from one of the many stand and pedal away. When you get tired refresh yourself with mugs of beer in the many bars. Enjoy your Tapas at the many tapas bars. Be careful of your personal belongings, your pockets can be picked very easily. Do not miss the Gaudi architecture and the Picasso museum. I f with kids there is a nice acquarium to enjo very close the fun and frolic La Ramla. Then you can wind up at the Barcelo Raval Hotel and enjoy the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “OK to stay”
Reviews.Author: AwfulRussian
Reviews.Content: I've had an issue while selecting suitable hotel in Barcelona. Most of these are either hugely overpriced or are of low quality / located in old buildings where one can hardly sleep based on the reviews. Barcelo Raval has been chosen based on its location (reasonably close to Rambla and other places of interest) and modern design. Despite of few issues we liked our stay. The delux room was modern and clean, although I appreciate that some people might not like the design at all. The toilet and bath are split, which is unusual for a hotel. There is no normal bathroom but just an isolated area in the corner of the room with a bath. Being on the bed you can't see a person taking a shower due to one-side mirror, but I understand comments from people who found this to be a major issue while sharing a room with someone you are not used to see naked :). Ok for couples, but not for sisters/brothers and sons/moms. The staff was nice and helpful enough (almost felt in love with nice-looking lady at the reception :), room was clean, location - up to expectations. Great views from the terrace. Never tried their breakfast which appears to be pricy. Good free wifi in rooms. Big in-room safety box for free. I've read reviews claiming the area to be unsafe, but had no such feeling. Till quite late all surrounding streets are full of tourists. Few issues on the negative site: 1/ Although we've asked for a standard room with a king-size bed, while checking in the lady at reception claimed that they have 2 beds options only. As this made us very unhappy, she kindly offered as an upgrade to delux for free (room 711). We were pleased to accept, though later realised this to be a trick :). As I mentioned the room was good enough, and king-size bed actually great, but due to some technical issue lights in the room could not be switched off at night unless you deal with the main tumbler. The issue is that it also turns off air con as well ... so you have a choice - whether to sleep with a light and air con or with no light but no air con as well. As we stayed in May it was not really an issue, but people may really suffer in July or August. I suspect this is something unfixable (at least they couldn't have it fixed for 5 nights we stayed there), thus they propose the room as a free upgrade. 2/ Sound-proofness between rooms is ok, however, when someone openes a door to the next room, you can hear that very well. The windows have a poor sound-proofness, and you can hear lot's of noise from the street despite of the 7th floor. 3/ I'm not sure what is the reason for putting a metal net on the whole building, but it does not add design value at all. If the purpose was to improve privacy in rooms, may I recommend one-side windows. 4) Slippers in rooms would not hurt as the floor is actually quite cold. Guess this is easy to fix in 4 star hotel as this is a low cost. None of the above has spoiled our 5 days stay, thus I may generally recommend the hotel at least to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wrong location”
Reviews.Author: MackKilkenny
Reviews.Content: You just can't build a top class hotel in one of the roughest parts of Barcelona and expect to rejuvenate the area. Exit the hotel and you have about 40 sets of eyes watching your every move from street corners. Side streets on both sides of the hotel are red light districts where we were frisked by pick pockets, offered drugs and approached by young women offering their services. The hotel is amazing, really top class and the food was great. But its all about location, location, location and they got this one very, very wrong. Don't be fooled either by the description of a rooftop pool. Our fish pond at home is about the same size.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: travellingblue
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very funky design with gorgeous interior designing. We stayed up the 9th floor and our room had great views of Barcelona. Try and get a room high up to get better views. The room has been cleverly done with LED lighting and controls for different light settings, and ipod dock and even a switch to shut the curtains. Bed was very comfortable and I think they have been really clever with the room design and made good use of the space. Breakfast was good for a European country and seemed fresh. Good location - 5 mins walk to La Rambla. We walked around late in the evening and never felt threatened at all - as other reviews may have suggested.

Reviews.Title: “If you wanna pay 160 euros for a single bed go right ahead”
Reviews.Author: maaxxx
Reviews.Content: The room I was given was way too small and had 2 tiny single beds and an awful view. When I'm paying 160+ euros, I expect way better than this. Also, their website is terrible and doesn't even mention that they have a gym. i would have brought proper gym clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and funky hotel with a difference, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jem999
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Raval. From the moment we walked through the front door we were impressed with the hotel. We loved the open plan layout of the B Lounge with its bold splashes of colour and uber cool bar. The theme continued in the funkily lit lifts and on into the cool retro bedrooms with their novel layout and great touches like the ipod dock and nespresso machine. The design of the room was really functional and fun with funky lighting, a superb roomy shower and very comfy beds. The view from the roof terrace was superb and provided a great setting to relax with a drink after a days sightseeing around the city. The food and drinks at lunchtime and in the evening were great, with a nice variety of dishes from tapas, to thai, to japanese to choose from. In the evening the B Lounge had a great atmosphere, lovely staff and the DJ played some cool tunes to boogie too later on. The location is just over 5 mins walk to the Ramblas and is not as seedy as some have suggested. There were plenty of tourists around and you just need to be as mindful as you do in any part of Barcelona. We really enjoyed our stay at the Raval and will definately stay there again when next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: pixiedust10
Reviews.Content: We had some concerns about the location of this hotel. Although it seems a little bit creepy, there was absolutely nothing to worry about! Also the hotel is sooo beautiful that you won't care about it's surroundings. I recommended this hotel to my friends so they are going there for their honeymoon.. There was a very helpful man on the reception which upgraded our room because we wanted a room from higher floor. The room was amazing, with its facilities, view, confort etc. We were really happy there :) It was so close to La Rambla and La Boqueria. We woke up everyday, went to Boqueria and ate lots of fresh fruit for the breakfast! I definetely recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyDad63
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on recommendation of daughter's experience of other Barcelo hotels- so knew the type of hotel we would experience.. Then checked on tripadvisor and were a little concerned re reviews about the area... It was a hotel with a very modern and interesting design and certainly a landmark for Barcelona. Staff- very friendly, helpful and welcoming- no communication problems. Breakfast- consistently good, fresh and varied choice. Rooms- comfortable but the open plan design means that you shouldn't expect much privacy in the bathroom! Air con could be an issue in hot summer months- couldn't get rooms cool enough for very comfortable sleep. Didn't check out the gym but the pool was laughable and the hotel would do well not to advertise this as a swimming pool! but the panoramic views from the roof terrace are worth the trip to the 11th floor. Area- good for access to metro- five minute walk. and a lot of tourist spots are walkable- such as the Ramblas and Barri Gotico. Didn't feel the same sense of threat that others had commented on -certainly a more colourful area. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOOW!”
Reviews.Author: Halfminuteman
Reviews.Content: Awesome design. The room felt spacious all though it was small. The beds were the best I have ever had. The location Rambla del Raval was authentic in a good way. Supernear Las Ramblas, Gothic, Born, the beach, Camp Nou etc. But beware of pocket thieves, that's for all of Barcelona. The hotel roof terrass have an amazing view. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotal BUT on muggers alley!”
Reviews.Author: yapop
Reviews.Content: we were really looking forward to a great city break in barcelona, our first time in the city, been advised to stay in the Gothic Quarter in the heart of the city. searched hotels and found great rates for a new four star hotel, website made it sound perfect. and it was, but to get to the hotel you have to walk approximatly 5 minutes up side streets from metro. One of the streets you take your life in your own hands as everyone looks like they are about to mug you, and on the other you go into the heart of the red light district and it is not pleasent. One afternoon the sun was shining and we sat in the bar to have cocktails, but the small square outside sat what can only be described as scarey characters and prostitutes. it was like being in gold fish bowl with a cat waiting for you to jump out and eat you. really not good. we stayed in and had a meal in the resturant or got taxi everywhere when it got dark. we were brave during the day!! which all added to the cost Another small thing, the swimming pool, is small to say the least i would think paddling pool would be a better discription. if you want to survive you trip to barcelona dont stay here. sadly great hotel built in wrong place

Reviews.Title: “W want to be, not a great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjchu
Reviews.Content: The look and feel is a want to be W. Very clean and service is great but not great for business. Breakfast is wonderful but the rest of the food is okay. Location could be better. The desk is non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location, Area not that Bad, Definitely Returning!”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The room was much bigger than I expected and I really liked the open plan bathroom. Really suited us as a couple, but may not suit if your travelling with a friend or family member. I loved the electronic curtains, infact I loved everything! There is a couple of different light settings which allow you to change the lights to your preference (night/day/only a little light). The view from the top floor terrace is amazing, you can actually see the whole of Barcelona and there are binnoculars/telescopes to let you get an even closer view. The pool on the top floor is pretty small but it seems more like an area to chill out with some cocktails rather than a full day of sunbathing. We stayed on the 4th floor and there was a little outside noise at night time, but Im quite a light sleeper and it never really kept me awake (It wasn't loud enough to complain about or ruin your holiday). There is a DJ that plays every Thursday, Friday and Saturday night in the lobby. He was very arty, reminded me of someone you'd see in the Glasgow Artschool and he played a good mix of funk and motown. Was a nice atmosphere for a few final drinks before retiring to bed. The alcohol prices may seem quite expensive but every bar we went to throughout the city was the same. The cheapest we paid for two drinks was 15euros and that was in the Hardrock Cafe. There is a nice Italian restaurant a couple of doors up from the hotel which served really good pizza and pasta. Now onto the area: I was really worried that we would be intimidated when leaving the hotel but I must say that our experience was the complete opposite. We weren't walking about any later than 12pm so perhaps it is different after then but before this time we never seen one prostitute and we never got hassled. As for the drug dealers, you get them in every part of the city (whether it be Las Ramblas, Barri Gottic, Raval, etc) but they didn't hassle us and were actually pretty friendly. The area really isn't that bad, I was quite shocked to hear some people's views on it because alot of Barcelona has original run-down looking streets, its part of Barcelona's character. The location was perfect. It is about 7min walk to the centre of Las Ramblas and it's pretty much a straight road, just ask reception for directions. Beware of the over-pricing taxi drivers!!! Ours bumped us of atleast 10euros in the ride from the bus station to the hotel. It should cost about 12/13euros max and that's including the supplement charge so ask them before you get into a taxi. Anymore than the 15 mark, they are extremely overcharging! We got charged 23euros going and 12euros returning after the hotel receptionist said it shouldn't be anymore than 12, so do watch out! Overall, I'll definitely be returning. I absolutely love Barcelona and I'm so glad I found this hotel that has so much charm and beauty to it, yet is much more reasonably priced than the other hotels on Las Ramblas. Tips- Try and explore Raval as there's loads of cool bars and restaurants. You should visit the zoo when your there for the dolphin show and visit the Nou Camp.

Reviews.Title: “design hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardvanginkel
Reviews.Content: beautiful(ly) design(ed) hotel with great features right in the heart of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MarkL4
Reviews.Content: fantastic city and the Barcelo Raval was an absolute steal. 2 minutes from the main strip 10 minutes to the quay and metro. Facilities were modern, crisp and clean and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: thelodge123
Reviews.Content: went on a 40th birthday with friends.hotel spotless greatstaff but soon as you step outside its like bayroot totally on edge. three of my friends got mugged at the back of the hotel money phones credit cards the lot. gone to the police needless to stay waist of time please dont take your wife n kids

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: spock1701
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as we have always had great service from the Barcelo group;& we were not disappointed Room was on the 6th floor,very clean ,excellent maid service.Breakfast was continental plenty of fresh fruit/cooked meats/cheese etc. Reception staff very friendly & helpfull;spoke at least 2/3 languages. A visit to the roof -11th floor-with its pool is a must the views of the city are awsome! The exchange rate with the £-euro was a lot worse than when we visited 2years ago. We found that a pint of beer was cheaper with the evening meal in restaurants -eating out still good value-than the Irish/Australian bars we visited-Baileys+pint 10euros-11.75euros very expensive We went for the football & even if you are not a Barca fan the Camp Nou is well worth a visit . We can no longer fly direct to Barcelona from Scotland in the winter so just a big thank you to Easy Jet as we flew Glasgow-Luton-Barcelona with them without any problems

Reviews.Title: “Edgy Barcelona digs - gritty neighbourhood not a hassle”
Reviews.Author: Global2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in May 2009 for fun after business in Poland, so we wanted somenthing funky and central. Barcelo Raval met that need perfectly. Firstly, we didn't find the area at all threatening. Sure its gritty, but I has an authenticity that many parts of this very touristy city do not. Any smart traveller knows that you need to be wise about walking a strange city after dark, but we walked the area up till 11pm without feeling at all uncomfortable. However, I had a great laugh at my poor husand being propositioned by a street walker for the first time. Welcome to Barcelona! The hotel is super-cool! We loved the hyper-modern decor, from the incredible lobby lighting to the room numbers pin-lit in the carpet outside your room. Rooms have adequate space without being "roomy". Pluses include a complimentary Lavazza pod coffee machine and lovely herbal teas replaced daily. Being able to enjoy the view over Spanish rooftops from the shower was cool, and loved the big thirsty towels. Took us a few minutes to work out the remote controlled curtains, but loved the ability to enjoy the amazing views whilst reclining on the kings size bed. Rooms also have ipod/iphone dock to enjoy your favourite tunes. Lobby bar service was indifferent, but with a city like Barcelona on your doorstep, who wants to loiter in the lobby? However, the cool factor was lifted a level by a racy magazine shoot in the pink lobby recessed couch on out day of departure! PS - Don't miss Fat Bike cycle tours of the city. Cruisy, friendly and a fun way to orient yourself at the beginning of your stay (www.FatTireBikeToursBarcelona.com)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: vs777Gloucestershire
Reviews.Content: If you like loud music for breakfast with your cold egg and bacon then the Barcelo Raval is for you. the bedrooms have a alarm flashing light in the celing which keeps you awake all night and if that doesn't then the street noise and noise from neighbours will . (due to thin walls) The rooms were very clean with comfortable beds, flat screen TV's coffee/ tea facilities and a lovely power shower. The front desk staff helpful and polite. We wouldn't stay here again, I like something more peaceful especialy over breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, interesting locale, excellent shower, great roof deck, but no frills and bad for families”
Reviews.Author: jazzroundmidnite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelo Raval during the second half of our week in Barcelona. We stayed at the Omm in Eixample for the first half. Overall, the affordability, convenience to Old City sights, and visual style of the Barcelo were superior to the more expensive Omm. However, the Omm offered more perks and more luxurious digs. I'd recommend the Barcelo Raval to folks that want a trendy, boutique-style hotel experience that is near all the sights but off the main tourist beaten path. Folks have said that the location is a bit dodgy so I wanted to address that. The location, in El Raval, is a more working class residential area with actual Barcelonans around and the shops and restaurants they patronize. After basking in the golden glow of Eixample for a few days, this was a great change of pace. We always felt safe in the area around the hotel, which is on a wide, boisterous street with a plaza that has a market on the weekend. You're only about a 10 minute walk from the Ramblas. The buildings and shops are a bit more run-down that those in El Born or La Ribera, but the streets are just as cute and winding. Nearby you'll find an entire street of vintage clothing boutiques and some good Pakistani food. You won't find any gourmet restaurants or high-end shops, but there are plenty of little dive bars and bodegas. The very large hotel itself was very stylish in appearance, though a bit of an eyesore from the outside. There's a rooftop terrace that offers an excellent, 360-degree view of the city. In the summer, the pool up there would be quite sweet. There's a gym, which seemed very nice with some cardio machines and free weights. The B-lounge on the ground floor is the hotel's restaurant/bar. It seemed a bit like an afterthought. There was a DJ spinning dance music there a few nights, but no one dancing. With all of the restaurants in the Old City and great South Asian restaurants nearby, there isn't much reason to eat the hotel. There's also a bunch of grocery stores close by if you want to grab some food and chill in your room and watch some bad TV shows. The rooms were fine overall: Pros: free wireless Internet, cool electronics, and an exquisite rainfall shower. Cons: annoying pink room lighting, windows do not open, weird perfume-y fragrance throughout hotel, and the rooms offer no privacy at all (Rooms would be bad for families, coworkers, friends, or any other folks that require some privacy from one another. The shower is towards the center of the room in a glass booth--so your roommates have a front row seat to you soaping up. Only the toilet room, which is about the size of an airplane bathroom, offers privacy.) There are no service frills to this hotel. No turn-down service, bell-hops, or friendly front desk greeters. The staff do not seem particularly accommodating and I'd fear what would happen if something went wrong in a room. Overall, if you are looking for a trendy, boutique-style hotel with no frills in an area that is off the beaten path, then the Raval is a reasonable option--if you can get a good price. Families, coworkers, and friends that aren't so close should stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel, unsafe area, not much service”
Reviews.Author: Hamburger_Deern
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 people (family) and stayed over the weekend. My summarization is: The hotel is very stylish and clean, but staff could be more friendly and service oriented. the area is not the best... Hotel is very stylish so gadget people will love it. The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable, so sleeping there was fine! Be aware of the area... The area around the hotel is a little strange, narrow streets with prostitution and drugdealing also during the day. However, it is very centrally located, it is walking distance to Las Ramblas. Service really needs improvement. When we arrived we asked specifically for non-smoking rooms. We were told that non-smoking rooms where only avalable in 2 hours. When we came back, we were given smoking rooms.We decided to keep the rooms because it did not smell so badly. At 6 o clock in the morning the alarm clock went on that the guest the night before had used. I would expect that this would be one of the things a maid checks and switches off when she does the room. I had trouble dealing with this high-end-tech-thing that I wasn't able to switch it off so tired I was! In the morning we realised the hairdryer did not work. We complained at the reception and waited but the hairdryer never came. We went down for breakfast with wet hair and even after we came back still no hairdryer. We complained again and when we came back at night, we had a hairdryer but it was not working at full speed and was smelling like burned plastic. Breakfast is not to be recommended. The price they charge is too high. There was chaos in the breakfast room, dirty dished piling up, the buffet empty, no coffee, the eggs that we ordered were cold. When we complained we were not charged for beakfast which was a nice gesture. But what also counts is how a message is delivered and most of the staff hardly ever smiles! With some exceptions the service personal at reception and at breakfast made an overstrained impression. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool, but a few shortcomings...”
Reviews.Author: Fivecorners
Reviews.Content: All the reviews tell you what's good - and there's a lot that is - but for a major hotel chain with masses of experience of what works and what doesn't we were surprised by a few shortcomings; nowhere to put your suitcase to unpack (unless you want to put the dirty wheels of your suitcase on the white bed linen); nowhere for Mrs guest to sit in front of a mirror for make up; no space around the basin for toiletries and (okay, it's only a small point) but the shower controls are at the back of the shower - getting the temperature right before the cascade of water hits you requires quite a contortion. Finally, if you're on a bit of a budget, give the mini bar a miss. Extortionate! Having said all that it's very funky; gadget people will love it. It's quite at nights, the beds are superb, the view's unique, the whole place is spotless and it's easy to get on foot to the key destinations. The rooftop pool is a plunge pool; more there to secure four stars I think than to provide a relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern style, comfortable and clean, great value.”
Reviews.Author: billrd
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with bright colours everywhere. Very comfortable beds and good nespresso machine in room. The roof top terrace has fabulous views. Rooms were spacious and included free Wifi. The area appears a bit seedy but we always felt safe walking around. There are a few good restaurants and bars close by. Overall the hotel represented very good value.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sums up what I like about Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: peterandwendy2
Reviews.Content: I've experienced Barcelo Hotels in the UK and always enjoyed them, so given they are a spanish group I thought I'd try them on this trip to Barcelona. We know the city well, and love its metropolitan funky style, it has lots of design - led hotels, thats what we look for. From outside it looks like an upturned waste paper basket, but that's great because from the rooms it doesn't stop the views, but people can't see in easily. The design is edgy quirky and fun, but what is important is that it actualy works as a well run hotel (we've been some places where its all a bout style and not about practicalities. The very best thing was the sunset bar - only open for a few ours in the evening on the roof, great views, and a really creative idea that demonstrates their approach to hospitality. I see some people comment on the dodgy side streets nearby, to be honest i don't think you are ever more than a couple of streets away from that sort of situation in Barcelona - you have to be street smart. The location is great to walk from, so much of what you want to do is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst - good for the cost”
Reviews.Author: LGDC
Reviews.Content: I always think it helps to know who writes these reviews - so, here I go: I am a woman in mid-30's and traveled w/ two friends (one male, one female). The female and I shared a room and the male had his own room. We travel a lot for work and stay at Hilton and Marriott hotels. The Barcelo Raval was super cool, modern and unique, which we loved. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, we were comfortable. The hotel is not in the best location - it is a short walk from Las Ramblas (the main street for tourists) which is great, however I would not have felt safe walking by myself at night - if you are with a friend, it's perfectly fine. And, I'm a city girl - I live in D.C., travel by myself to a lot of places, etc. And, although the room looked cool - it wasn't very functional - the shower door is all glass and is right by the sink and there is no door to this area, so if you are modest, it's hard for two people to get ready at the same time - if one needs to use a sink. Of course were on vacation, so there was no need to rush through our morning routine - just wanted to point that out. The toilet is through a separate door, not near the sink. We got one set of towels that were dirty - I'm sure it was just a mistake. And, when we asked for new towels - it took us three asks to get them. Once again, we were on vacation and it wasn't the end of the world - just a little annoying. There was free Internet - that was a big plus! And, so was the rooftop bar - a beautiful view of the city. Overall, I feel we got what we paid for - which is good. And, if I were to return to Barcelona, I would not be the slightest bit upset if I stayed here again, I would just prefer to find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, especially for young people”
Reviews.Author: natmer13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from 9/28 - 10/1 and it was absolutely great. We were given a room on the 6th Floor (Rm 602), which had a fantastic view of Barcelona. The room was very modern with cool lighting and was much more spacious than I had anticipated considering that I had never been to Europe and had read many reviews of other hotels that complained of rooms being small. We had ample space for 2 people to move around. Everything in the room is electronic, including the control for opening the curtains (which took us a few minutes to realize). It was very dark and quiet. There was an LCD tv and an Ipod docking station. The hotel staff was helpful and accomodating when we originally requested a room on a higher floor. There is a rooftop lounge that has a fantastic 360 degree view of Barcelona with a pool (unfortunately it was not operable while we were there). We never ate in the restaurant so have no opinion on that but the lobby and hotel are very cool. Perfect for young people b/c it is very modern and chic....reminded me a bit of a hotel that you would find in South Beach. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The only negatives that I would have to say are that the hotel is in a semi-shady part of town on Ramblas de Raval. It is on a main street that is large, but to get here from Las Ramblas you have to walk down smaller streets that can definitely be a little sketchy at night, depending on which street you walk down, there are lots of prostitutes. There is a good police presence though and as long as you have your wits about you, it's fine. Also, the bathroom is not in a separate room but partially in the room. The shower was right next to the bed and you can pretty much here everything that goes on in the room with the toilet, so if you're shy around the person that you're going with, it may not be the best choice to share a room. All in all, we had a great experience at this hotel and would definitely stay here again if we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, and the most comfy beds ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: chefshaw
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern and hip hotel just off rambla. Amazing rooftop views of the whole of barcelona. A must stay hotel with the most comfy beds of alltime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Modern Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: ccash25
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, asked for a king size bed and received a free upgrade. Hip hotel with modern flair. The shower has a rain shower and is clear glass into the room. Nice rooftop bar and 360 degree city and ocean views. Food and drinks at the hotel restaurant were good too. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Super hi-tech hotel - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: blckscream
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of July. The hotel itself is a very cool oval structure. It's super modern and "hi-tech". The room glowed a pink neon. You can turn off/on the lights and black out shades with a click of button. The bed was great, shower was good, too. The room was small, but utilized the space well. Free internet, mini fridge, AC, awesome roof deck, etc...Perfect for a 2 day trip. The neighborhood was a little sketchy, but walk 2 blocks and your on la rambla. Also, we always found a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel- loved it”
Reviews.Author: MTLIDS
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Barcelo Raval. The rooms are beautiful and really high tech. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. The top floor terrace offers an amazing view of Barcelona and a nice bar where you can enjoy a cocktail while the sun sets. The hotel has the most amazing fragrance throughout the entire hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: scmk3000
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as an extension of my visit to Barcelona. Absolutely loved it. We met up with some locals and they told us that the area was indeed where some prossies USED to hang out but police had been trying to emliminate it as it's an area definately up and coming. The Raval area was well lite and again did see lots of police patrolling at night. I might have come across a couple of more questionable characters loitering late at night but not once I felt I was in any danger. Rambla del Raval (where the cat is - yes huge back cat sculpture - should you get lost) is just off the main La Rambla but more local I felt and surrounded by lots of eartern asian restaurants and stores as well as bars which open till very late at night - everything was just a short walking distance away - very convenient, yet not manic like La Rambla. The hotel was very new and it was built from scratch, finished last year I was told. It was quite special. It is a circular building (11/F) and wrapped round by a 'cage' so you can't see into the rooms from outside. Inside was very modern and brand spanking new. Receiption staff were friendly and everyone looked beautiful. We were given a room on the 3rd floor (rooms on higher floors were delux rooms, suites etc) and I thought it was going to be noisy - but no, I don't recall any noisy at all! The room numbers were projected onto the floor in the corridor and doors are unlocked by scanning rather than inserting the card - pretentious but loved it. The room was quite 'open-plan'. You walk into the room and toilet and storage/safe etc were next to the door. Movable partition for closing the toilet door. But as soon as you walk into the room, straight away you see a mirror hanging over a sink in the middle with coffee machine on the other side and minibar underneath it. Shower right next to it and it's glass door and partition separating from the bed area. So if you are with just a friend, it could be quite odd. Otherwise it's quite nice and romantic. The bed area was spacious but the 'double bed' was two beds put together which is one thing I never particularly liked. Not sure if they did do one double bed in other rooms though. Buttons to draw/open the curtains to a ceiling to floor windows. Big enough LCD TV with many many channels. Just a little desk underneath the TV that can be moved around. Had an iPod with me so was glad to see a dock for it! Two minor complaints, because of the glass windows, room can get very hot during the day and felt a/c wasn't powerful enough. Also, doors are literally right next to each other so you could hear people openning their doors and wake you up. I could pick up free Wifi from our room too but no sure if it's the same on higher floors. Gym was very very spacious and had a few machines and they were all new and of latest models. It also had a sauna. There was a overhead shower area with quite a few settings which was fun. A separate gents and ladies shower/bathroom with lockers for your valuables. Sounds good enough? Wait until to go up to the roof-top lounge. There was, as one of other reviewer described, oversized tub which no one used and drinks were way overprized. But what you have is a 360 panoramic view of the city and at night it was stunning and utterly romantic. We stood there mesmorizing and chatting for an hour without realising it. I just loved it. The neighbourhood might not be of everyone's taste but for a young couple wanting a romantic city break but with a budget, this is a good as you can get. I will definately go back to Barcelo Raval in the future and recommend my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrSoprano
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, very modern and the pool on the roof is great after a long day walking around the streets of Barca. just off Las Ramblas to so not in a nosiy part of the city, and close to everything. i highly recommend this hotel to people of all ages and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Modern Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Aeryn_Spacechick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within a 5 minute walk of La Ramblas. A lot of reviews on here say that they felt nervous with the red light district etc. We are 2 20 something year old girls and never saw any evidence of this. The route to La Rambla (down Career L'Hopital) is well lit & quite busy so there is no need to feel unsafe!! There are also plenty of taxis on La Ramblas in case you have one too many glasses of Sangria and can't remember the way - which will cost 5-6 Euros. The hotel has a small pool on the roof which is a nice retreat to cool off from the scorching sunshine - but its not really big enough for a swim. The rooms are cleaned to a high standard daily & all of the staff are very friendly & helpful. There is a taxi rank situated just outside the hotel for easy transport all over Barcelona. NOTE OF WARNING - Most taxi drivers in Barcelona have not heard of the hotel so you need to tell them the street name Rambla Raval - however this can often be mis heard to you are best to point to it on the back of your room key!! The hotel is really well decorated, funky colours & lighting & is at the top end of fixtures & fittings it really is only the fact that this hotel is not more central that its not 5*. We would definitely recommend this to any one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great style but not so great service”
Reviews.Author: worldwidegirl86
Reviews.Content: Well, stayed there for a weekend. The rooms and the whole hotel are very modern and stylish. Pretty much all the lights are led's and either green, pink or blue. But the service in the restaurant was very bad. It took ages, they forgot things and weren't very friendly. It is situated not even 5 minutes from the Rambla but I was a bit worried about walking back at night because the actual neighborhood is low standard

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and funky”
Reviews.Author: dmaher01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Jul 2009. I have to agree with the other reviewers that the area surrounding the hotel is not fantastic but the hotel more than makes up for it. If you are into design you will love this hotel. The rooms are amazing with the shower cubicle right in the center of the room. We only had one gripe and that was that our frend who had booked later than us and on our recomendation got a room with a much better view while we ended up on the first floor despite us requesting a high floor. I would also not recommend eating breakfast at the hotel as I think it was a bit over priced at 18 euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel In Up & Coming Area”
Reviews.Author: LeapingGazelle
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surpise for my wife's 40th birthday celebration at travel supermarket. We stayed Monday to Friday. The hotel is a modern property in the heart of Barcelona. We had a room on the 9th floor with a fab view over the city. The room was modern, clean and very comfortable with an open plan feel. The shower and beds were fantastic. The hotel has a tiny roof top pool which was always too busy too use and a nice, modern lounge and bar area and a small gym with state of the art equipment. The hotel has 2 free Mac PC's in the lobby for free internet use. Service in the hotel lounge and bar was a little slow. However all staff we encountered were freindly. The hotel is a 5 - 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas and 15 minutes from Place de Catalunya. The hotel is near 4 different metro stations which were no more than 10 mins walk away. We were on a room only basis and went to the local market (La Boqueria) on Las Ramblas were you can get fresh juices and pastries every morning. The Raval district of Bracelona is an up and coming area of the city. It had a nice local feel about it with good Spanish bars and restaurants, all within close proximity to the hotel. It was nice to be away from the very busy Las Ramblas, yet close enough to get to very easliy. Taxi's are available outside the hotel at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: monserratlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in March with a friend and had a great experience. It is located minutes from Las Ramblas and is very convenient by day. The small streets to get to the hotel at night are a little shady but we found a good enough route. The hotel itself is very trendy and unique. The room has a fun feel to it and is fully stocked. A little uncomfortable with the overly exposing shower but overall impressed with the room. The front staff was able to speak English and was helpful in answering our questions. Free internet access in the lobby is a major bonus. Also I think I made my way up to the rooftop every day to take in the views of the city and the waterfront. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not so nice to get to”
Reviews.Author: bluishme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within 5-7 minutes walk from the Liceu metro station on Las Ramblas. The hotel is new and has a good designer feel. We booked an advanced double room without breakfast. The room is not exactly big but contains everything you'll need, with a designer touch. The shower and basin are blended into the room (sort of open plan), while the toilet is accessed by a sliding mirror door, alternating from a closed toilet or a closed wardrobe, which housed a safebox. The curtains are controlled conveniently from buttons at the bedside table There are toiletries, towels, coffee machine and tea bags (complimentary), hair dryer, iPod docking station (iPod only; does not work with iPhone, but you can still charge your iPhone), paying mini bar provided in the room. There is free wifi (pretty good at 2Mbs) within our room and in the lounge area, which also has two PCs. You'll need the get the wifi password from the reception. On the 11th floor, a roof terrace provides a panorama view with free telescope, although the view is not particularly striking. A bar also opens in the evening, but i don't think anyone would stop you to bring your own drinks. There is an outdoor 'pool' but it's the size of two bathtubs? The main downside is access to the hotel from Las Ramblas. You have to go through small streets which are a bit rough and feels a bit dodgy. Lots of non-Spanish locals around, although there are equally as many tourists. There's a few Asian supermarkets along the way but you will find a Spanish supermarket just behind the hotel. There was a Raval neighbourhood festival (not spanish music) at the weekend so the noise level was pretty high until 1 or 2pm. Having said that I was so tired that I slept ok anyway. A nice hotel if you don't mind the small streets getting to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: k4477
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a winner. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice, beds were comfy. It was pretty quiet and really dark- good for sleeping at night, sleeping in in the mornings and napping in the afternoons. It's a great location. It's in the Raval, which is a cool (if somewhat seedy) neighborhood in and of itself and an easy walk from the metro and La Rambla. It's a tall building with a bar and a pool on the roof with amazing reviews of Barcelona- you can see the port, La Sagrada Familia, everything. Really cool. I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, quiet, easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: RamblinJoe
Reviews.Content: Usually I prefer to stay at less trendy, rather more low key and friendly hotels, but it was busy busy busy so I opted for the Raval. It has a good combination of edgy modern design, cordial staff and on one of the newer up and coming squares (wonderfully restored) off the Ramblas. The spaces and room were beautiful with a tongue in cheek design and not over the top. What else could you ask for? Well, the pool is so small, its more like a large bath, and the guests seemed a little over self-conscious and looked bored and tired! Hey but that's not the fault of the hotel! And it's quiet in our room, but it was a Wednesday night. And 10-15 minutes walk from where the Aerobus dropped us in Placa Catalunya. Good!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: StraightDownTheLine
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here for 5 nghts in July 09 and we found it very nice, the hotel as has been said is very modernistic and well er.. modern really.There`s a nice foyer area with internet access if you require it plus a bar resuraunt area but to be honest we can`t really give a fair comment on the latter two as we never tried them as we chose to venture out all the time.The room was very clean and yes you`ve guessed it.. modern, which again was very nice.If you`re new to Barcelona here`s a tip for you I suggest on your arrival you venture up to the top floor where you may access a viewing area with a great panoramic view of the city, this will help you get a scale and perspective of the place with the aid of local landmarks.So yes a great hotel, as for location again very good, straight outside the hotel there are various bar/resuraunt venues catering for varous tastes... kebab,tapas and fish `n chips (yep there`s a place across the boulevard selling fish `n chips), if you hang a left as you exit the hotel there`s a place at the bottom of the street on your left where you can get a breakfast this place always seemed to be open in the morn when others were closed..The area itself is a pretty multicultural one and I suspect it`s seen harder times but don`t let that put you off as its fine now and yes as has already been mentioned you will witness the red light zone as you make your way to the famous Ramblas (which by the way is only about 10 mins walk away) but there seems always to be a large police presence and at no time did we feel uncomfortable.To sum up we say "great hotel and location" and oh yes one more thing the aerobus drops you off at Placa Catalunya and if your reasonabally fit its about a 20-25 min walk to this hotel otherwise get on the metro at Placa Catalunya (LINE 3) and head for the Liceu station and its a 10 min walk from there.Hope its usefull , Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Been here before, but standards are slipping”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: When i first went to this hotel late last year, it was fantastically clean, excellent rooms, such a change from the norm in barcelona. ive gone this time, there seems to be a lack of staff, cleanliness is not up to its previous standard, lime scale on the shower head which is making the water go everywhere. The restaurant in the hotel, thank-god hasnt changed. the staff are brilliant, quite reasonably prices and the food really is to die for. its in a good place and it is a beautiful building, but saying some bad things, i think i would stay there again if the price was right. u do get free wifi (password obtained from reception) and there are 2 apple mac computers in the lobby area. i would like to see the hotel brought up to a cleaner standard, and things now need to be replaced, i know this is due to customers using the rooms but "hey, its a hotel" thats what its there for. FAILING THIS MY OTHER RECOMMENDED HOTEL IS THE tryp apolo in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: rafi7
Reviews.Content: Went for 3 nights with my best friend and we loved it! The reviews are spot on about the surrounding area so beware and cautious. The hotel is ultra modern, very clean and smells divine!! We found the staff very helpful and there was security on the door all the time during our stay. We ate out as we thought the breakfast was far too expensive so cant comment on the restaurant. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, unusual and well located”
Reviews.Author: Vicky M
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Barcelo Raval for 3 nights in January 2009 and had an absolutely fantastic time! If I go back to Barca (or should I say 'when' I go back) I would definitely consider staying in this hotel again because it was lovely and really added a special touch to our trip. It wouldn't be to everyone's taste as it has a very modern, almost futuristic feel to it. The decor is gorgeous - both minimalist and over the top at the same time, which helps to avoid that cold atmosphere which some modern hotels have. The bright pink walls, horse lamp and silver pigs on the tables in the lobby are all examples of the love it or hate it appeal of this place! As you head further up you can get a great view of the city from the rooftop, where there is also a small pool and bar. We didn't use these as it was too chilly in January, but they seemed quite nice. The pool definitely isn't big enough to do laps but would be great to cool down on hotter days. There are three room types available - superior, deluxe and junior suites. We booked a superior but were upgraded to a deluxe by the lovely hotel staff when they learnt that the holiday had been a surprise Xmas gift. The deluxe rooms are slightly larger and higher up than the superiors, offering a great view over the city. Some people have criticised the view but I thought it was brilliant. At the end of the day, you are in a city and shouldn't expect to see expanses of trees or beaches, although you can see the coast from some rooms (we were amongst the lucky). The room itself was very comfortable and the bed was hands-down the best bed I've ever slept in in a hotel! We had lovely thick quilts which kept us warm in the slightly chillier evenings. The shower was another great feature - a waterfall shower that falls straight down onto you and is surrounded by glass with strategically placed frosting. The shower would admittedly make life a little harder if you aren't particularly close to your room buddies, but as a couple it's one of the best things about the place :) Another lovely little extra was the Tassimo coffee-maker in the room, which is free to use and gets restocked every day. Don't go near the mini-bar, it'll cost you the earth! The location overall was pretty good - Barca is so well connected by the underground tubes that it never takes very long to get anywhere. Some people apparently had breakfast bundles left on their door handle each morning, but we didn't sign up for those and really didn't miss them as there are some great little places to eat not too far from the hotel. There are supermerkats round the corner and plenty of great bars just outside the hotel in the Ramblas. Some people have expressed discomfort with the diversity of characters in the Ramblas area, but we loved the atmosphere, which is quite relaxed and a little bohemian. At night you may well notice ladies offering their business, and some even approached us, but we found that a simple 'no' and shake of the head sent them away, so it didn't bother us at all. There are so many good things I could say about this hotel and so many wonderful little finds when you explore, but I don't want to go into any more detail because discovering the place for yourself is half the fun. Barcelo Raval is definitely worth staying at and I really can't recommend it enough, especially to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Edgy hotel, edgy neighborhood - not for the feint of heart”
Reviews.Author: architrekker
Reviews.Content: Barcelo Ravel is a cutting edge design, both in the public spaces and the rooms. If you are a modern design junkie, you will probably enjoy it. If you are looking for a traditional 4 or 5 star hotel, this is not for you. The hotel is on a small rambla (linear park), with some small local restaurants nearby. It is a 10-minute walk to the Liceau metro station on the Ramblas, generally not a bad location. Unfortunately, it is also next to the main prostitute area of Barcelona, on the street behind the hotel. I saw a doorman once during my 4-day stay. The only other staff that I saw were one or two staff at the reception desk, who would not even make a recommendation for a local restaurant. The rooftop pool and deck are a narrow sliver along the edge of the roof, the pool no more than a large whirlpool. The rooftop bar was never open during my stay. The rooms were a very interesting design which, as an architect, I generally liked. The bathrooms are completely open to the bedrooms, so if privacy is an issue you should not stay here. There is very little horizontal space for toiletries, laptop, etc. I found the rooms noisy from plastic furniture being moved over the tile floors (please, can you install felt pads on the bottom of the chairs?)

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clazee
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is really quite something. And although one member of staff should not taint your view of all, one member of staff in particular was the most unhelpful rude individual I have ever come across staying in a hotel. We only asked for some milk for coffee!!! The location itself is fantastic however some of the streets heading into La Rambla are a little unsavoury, making my firend and I feel very uncomfortable. That said the hotel is fantastically modern and great on a friday and Saturday night with live DJs and the drinks and food are not overpriced at all

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: sm0ggie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with friends in mid June to celebrate her 40th birthday. It was our second time in Barcelona but the first time at this hotel, and it was a great visit. I think the hotel has been recently re-fitted, and is very modern, clean and fresh. If there is a complaint there is a degree of style over substance, for example somewhere to hang towels after use would be nice, but you can't have everything! The rooms are reasonably spacious and well appointed. The staff were all very friendly and helpfull. The hotel has a pool and bar on the roof, and whilst the pool is rather small, the bar is great place to sit and chill before a night out, with views all over Barcelona - although make sure you have plenty of euros if you are planning a few drinks in the hotel. The location is good, in a largely residential area, and very close to the Ramblas, less than five minutes walk. There are a few bars/restaurants on the square that the hotel is on which are mainly used by locals so a lot more reasonably priced than those on the Ramblas and the other tourist areas. For an excellent restaurant try Ra which is to the back of the market off the Ramblas, again mainly used by locals not tourists it is well priced and the food is excellent - but you do need to book. Barcelona is an amazing city which never fails to disappoint whether for sight seeing, shopping, food and drink, or just chilling out. Start the day with a cortado at Cafe Zurich on Playa Catalunya and see where you go from there. The metro is a great way to get about, and is cheap and clean. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option for Barcelona on leisure”
Reviews.Author: JoaoF
Reviews.Content: The Barceló Raval is well located (in the "new" Raval), just 5 min from the Ramblas boulevard. Everything in Barcelona centre (gothic district, Ramblas, Catalonia place, even the port) is at walking distance. And it's a brand new hotel, a unique round building and very fashionable. Rooms are very good and only the breakfast was bellow expectations (too much people there at the same time). Will definitely go back to this one when visiting Barcelona for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monmonmon
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, enjoyed it from the first sight - the design, colours, decoration, funky gadgets, roof top terrace with pool, service, food and everything about it was just amazing! Great location distance wise however in a bit dodgy area unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Monoke
Reviews.Content: I'm lying in bed right now in this fab hotel, although I'm not enjoying the funky décor or indulging in the well stocked mini bar. No, I'm having another nights sleep ruined by the ignorant staff here who are making a ridiculous amount of noise cleaning the rooms, grinding the king size bed off the floor tiles and sending a holiday destroying rumble up and down the hotel, there is no escaping it. I can not sleep in this hotel! So rude! So ignorant! So tired!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: EalingDwellers
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us in to stay at the Barcelo as a surprise for my birthday. He could not have chosen a better place. From beginning to end the experience was great: The hotel is exceptionally stylish and in great condition throughout. The food in the "B lounge" in the lobby is fantastic, delicious and well presented. Our room was as spacious as it needed to be, the shower really was amazing, the bed is huge and the view was awesome. Breakfast was served at very reasonable times (up to 11am!) and offered a wide range of good quality options. We had no problems ordering. The view from the 11th floor was spectacular, we would recommend heading up there at sunset. We weren't brave enough to try the pool though.... The area is fine, yes it isn't the poshest but just use a bit of sense and you'll be fine. At no point did we feel remotely worried and were on La Rambla within 3 minutes. I think if this hotel was in a different place it would be unaffordable. We had lunch at Cinc Sentis which we would also highly recommend, truly incredible food and great service. The whole weekend was fabulous, mainly because of how much we enjoyed the hotel. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough, if you are going to Barcelona you MUST stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Area”
Reviews.Author: Lovesit11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Barcelo Raval for 6 nights and was very impressed with the hotel and how clean it was. The staff speaks English however they are not all polite. The hotel itself is very modern and sleek however the rooms are small. The hotel is located in an area that is scary. I traveled with a friend and as two young girls we were constantly scarred to take the side streets to Las Ramblas. The hotel does not have a concierge so we asked for directions from the front desk staff as well as restaurant recommendations and the staff made us feel like they were too busy to help. Overall it was a great place to stay with a unique experience but I would not recommend walking around at night near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, area "not so much"”
Reviews.Author: LondonVan
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on lastminute.com and stayed at the Barcelo Raval for 4 nights in the last week of May. This hotel is FANTASTIC!!! It's very modern in design and features, and attention has been paid to the smallest of details. The staff couldn.t be more helpful, we were upgraded for free and every restaurant recommendation (from budget restaurants to the best tapas bars were excellent). We are "foodies" and in our opinion the best tapas restaurant in Barcelona is Ciudad Condal, GO GO GO!!! The roof top pool is an absolute oasis after a hot day of sightseeing with 360 degree views across Barcelona. There is also a spa, sauna and fitness centre however we never too advantage of them. The hotel is located a quick 10 minute walk from La Ramblas however it is not the nicest of areas. We never encountered any problems or felt threatened however we made sure that we had very little cash on us and never walked around with a camera on display. If this hotel was in a nicer area, they could charge double or triple what we paid. I would stay here however budget to take taxis at night if you feel uncomfortable, they are never more than 8 Euros each way.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth checking this one next time you go to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gi7
Reviews.Content: New, fun deco, very well located at walking distance from Raval and most other Barcelona's hot spots. We had a beautiful corner room, with a splendid view of the city, the staff was very helpful, the lounge nice and comfy and the rate was very attractive. If we go again, we'll most probably return to the same hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: chillandrelax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a five night break at the Barcelo Raval. I have to say we were very impressed by the design and standard of this hotel. If you like ultra modern this is the hotel for you. We had a deluxe room on the 10th floor which overlooked the city and port area. We particularly liked the quirky design of the room with the shower and sink unit in the middle of the room. Our room was decorated in cerise others are in lime. At night the bed was alluminated by a neon glow in the head board plus no chance of struggling to find the loo which had blue neon lights at the entrance. ipod docking/radio plus flat screen tv, mini bar and safe available in room and remote control curtains plus an expresso coffee maker. The terrace on the top floor has 360 panoramic views with comfy chairs and sun loungers available, plus the plunge pool/jacuzzi was a nice feature. The reception, bar and dining area are open plan again decorated in cerise, black and silver, nice feature was the large model of a horse and pig in reception plus silver pigs were dotted about this area. There is an outside terrace facing a new unoccupied office block where the locals tended to sit and chat or play with their children in the evening. The only minor issue we had was the difficulty in getting staff to understand what you wanted as part of an english breakfast. The second morning my husband didn't get his order after asking three times, although he made do with continental. We found that if I ordered first he would end up with the same and on the last morning we only asked for fried eggs and got full english !! One tip bring your own tea bags I forgot, coffee nice but unless you like very weak tea forget it. I know from other reviews people mentioned the dodgy area, but we found it colorful and interesting. We walked around this older part of the city day and night but never felt nervous or intimidated. Plus it is only 5 mins walk from Las Rambla. There is a great little restaurant just outside the hotel called Faggur the tapas was authentic and charged half the price of restaurants on the Rambla the most expensive bottle of wine was 11 euro where on the Rambla for house wine we paid 21 euro. Overall enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would return again if we travel to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “some things to know before...”
Reviews.Author: Vagor
Reviews.Content: on the plus side, the design is wonderful, the ipod dock and netspresso machine very comfy, the view from the top floor is astonishing (behind the huge iron grid)! the bar is also nice. the staff also speaks english... Room design is magnificent but there is not much room for put your stuff. also no smoking on top floors...! small swimming pool, and a bit noisy. This light that you see above the bed does not have a switch to turn OFF. Yes, its nice when you see it on a photo, but not nice directly on your face! To turn it off you need to switch off the main power supply to the room (and open bathroom light) the neiborhood is very ethnic. lots of ethnic fast food (open at night) and stores, few bars, some prostitudes and a bit dangerous. Location is good, Barri Gothic has more bars, Eixample is the expensive part of the city, all close with metro and lots of walking around, especially to find a good resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, funky decor, very clean”
Reviews.Author: AverageAmerican
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Raval is a new hotel with very funky decor. It has some unusual features such as floor to ceiling glass with automated curtains, however the outside of the building is completely encased in sort of a chain link mesh. The room uses the shower and sink as a room divider separating the bath and bed areas. The shower is obscured glass on the bed side and clear glass on the bath side. No nasty shower curtain! The shower was very spacious and had a ceiling mounted waterfall type shower spout but also a body spray as well. The bed was very comfortable and the towels were generous in size and very fluffy. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. And the hotel is very very clean. Breakfast on the door in the morning was a nice way to get started. The only negative comment I have on the room is that there is very little counter area to set things. There was just one counter area in the closet on which to set one piece of luggage, the night stands were smallish and the desk was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiCaTi
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Booking via the hotel chain's website we felt we got a good deal on accommodation in central Barcelona and have recommended this hotel to others. Agree with others regarding the location; on one hand it is dead close to central Barcelona, but it is out on a bit of a limb. Having said that, we never felt unsafe walking around the area even at night, and there are come funky little cafes tucked away down the side streets. The hotel itself is superb if very stylised and perhaps not to everyones taste. The staff are very helpful and welcomed our baby daughter, even encouraging us to sit her on the life-sized model horse in the foyer! Prior to this I had been a little concerned that children would not be made welcome; this was not the case. The only downside was the easily accessible minibar; our baby soon learnt that if she wedged her arm through the gap either side of the door, crisps would magically appear! Overall this hotel I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The breakfast is great, the top floor deck is fantastic, the rooms are funky and its a great base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: showbaby
Reviews.Content: If you like modern amenities, then this is the hotel for you. The hotel is only 10 minutes walk away from the noise and rowdiness of Las Ramblas. Having read a lot of reviews about the location, I was a bit apprehensive especially because I was travelling on my own, luckily I did not have a bad experience. The area is mainly residential and there was a bit of Police presence when I was there. From the Las Ramblas, you can get to the hotel through 2 main streets Hospital and La Pau, I would advise that anybody going to the hotel should take the Hospital entrance and it is a busier road. Also the La Pau seems to have Prostitutes soliciting for business even during the day. I was there for 3 nights and felt save enough to walk back to the hotel as late as 10.30pm at night. The hotel itself is amazing and I cannot fault it in anyway, however if you're planning to stay at this hotel with a friend that you're not very close with, you may find it a bit intrusive without any privacy.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: morena2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April, and the Hotel is great, but as described by others the neighborhood it´s not very good, I don't recommend it to single ladies!! But the location is excellent- very close to Las Ramblas and the fantastic markets (in 5 minutes we are at the main ramblas)! Our room in the Hotel (9th floor) was very nice with a fantastic view, very clean, a great decoration and the view from the 11th foor is amazing. Great value, book it at the www.booking.com!!! It´s a modern hotel with a great style, very original! It was my first time in Barcelona and I recommend this hotel to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, have to agree about the area”
Reviews.Author: Becs04
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to Barcelona and a 4 night stay at the Barcelo Ravel. I have to agree with all the other reviews on here in the fact that the hotel itself is lovely but the area is shady! I live in London so thought nothing could shock me, but I felt very uncomfortable around the area. Prostitutes and some shady characters were rife and our visit was marred by the fact that I got punched in the face by a nutter whilst minding my own business! I'm a 29 year old small female! So depsite this incident, the hotel is clean, comfortable and very modern! The roof terrace is a great touch and if it had of been warmer I would have got in the pool! Loved the shower and the breakfast on the doors in the morning was a great touch! The staff were all very friendly and helpful although when we rang for room service no one could speak english so our order was wrong (although still very tasty!) I would still highly recommend this hotel to people but please take heed of all these reviews and be careful!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but dodgy area!!”
Reviews.Author: kaygwen40
Reviews.Content: We satyed here in March, and the Hotel is great, but as described by others the area is a bit dodgy!! especially at night, unless you stick to the main road off La Ramblas. The room in the Hotel is very hi tech and the views from the 11th foor is amazing.The complementary breakfast hanging on our door every morning was a nice suprise too. The only problem i could find with the hotel was the overpowering smell of mens aftershave in the foyer, which i didnt like at all!! Barcelona is an amazing city. The Tourist Bus is a must , but make sure you get off and see the sights on foot as well. And wrap up on top of the Bus as it gets very breezy!The Olympic Stadium and the Sagrada Familia were the highlights. But a walk on the Beach is great too.

Reviews.Title: “A definite reccomend!!”
Reviews.Author: astris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and had an amazing time. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. we upgraded to one above the 6th floor and the view was definitely worth it. The staff were extremely helpful, reccomending restaurants all over Barcelona, making reservations and giving us maps with directions. they were very friendly as well. The cocktail bar was a bit disappointing, not as wide a range as youwould expect from a bar like that. The area is safe enough, but I would definitely reccomend sticking to main roads in and out the Raval. We got eyed up a few times while walking down some of the side streets. The shower was in the middle of the room as said, but it's frosted glass so it's hard to see anything unless you really try. wouldn't have been a problem for us either way, but only an issue if you are really shy.

Reviews.Title: “a tale of two cities”
Reviews.Author: tabbyfur
Reviews.Content: We simply loved the hotel itself. Decor fab, service superb, very courteous, immaculately clean and well-kept, stunning roof-top views. Could do with more hooks in the bedroom but shower stunning and provided with all sorts of toiletries, including rasers as well as all the usual equipment. Expensive breakfast - arm-and-leg job. Respectable other guests. However, seedy district around the hotel - with no noticeable police presence - women would not feel comfortable walking in the poorly-lit and intimidating lanes connecting between Las Ramblas and the hotel at night. Very dodgy dealings going on in every single walkway to the town. It´s time the area was "cleaned up" big time. Not suitable for families or women alone unless you feel you want to walk into a stage set for West Side Story !

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, service and location not so great”
Reviews.Author: 09florence09
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a romantic weekend with my boyfriend. The deluxe room we had was fantastic, comfortable, spotless, stylish, bright and spacious. The hotel looks great, the lobby and roof terrace etc are all very pleasing to be in. The only negative things were: unbelievably slow service in the B Lounge downstairs, plus they charged me for the next table's drinks, took about 20 minutes to sort it out and didn't even apologise - so generally not good service though the front desk staff are friendly. Also a plastic bottle of mineral water in the room costs 5.50 euros... And finally although I read the reviews about the area being a bit dodgy, I didn't think it really would be (after all I come from south London round the corner from Brixton) - but I have to say I found it surprisingly edgy and didn't feel at all comfortable wandering around it at night. It's fine if you just head to the Ramblas, or know exactly where you're going though. But next time I would probably stay in the Gothic area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (not a family hotel, that's for sure)”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Barcelona. I did not book this hotel - it was booked for me. But I was not disappointed. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful (definitely helpful for someone who doesn't speak a lick of Spanish, or more appropriately, Catalonian). The room was nice (though a bit dark in the evening, even with all of the lights on). Seeing as how the shower has a glass wall by the bed, it's definitely not a family hotel. But I don't think they ever intended it to be. The B-Lounge had good food. Tapas are their specialty, I believe. I was not disappointed. I was told it was located in the red light district, but I never came across anyone that would fit that description. Though in the evening, you need to walk the 4 or 5 blocks to the Ramblas to find any activity. The Gothic District is a short walk away and all the tourist spots (Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, etc) are short taxi (or subway) rides away.

Reviews.Title: “Style Superb, well located and fun”
Reviews.Author: kalide
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a long weekend. This is my kind of motel - designer modern yet functional, sleek yet warm, and very simple check in of the no hassles variety. Location is excellent - in an emerging area being slowly redeveloped - close to Las Ramblas and the fantastic markets, all within walking distance of most cool bars and restaurants and just a pleasure to be there. Of course the Raval area comes with its minor downsides but any careful traveller who's been to NY, San Fran, Amsterdam, London, Sydney etc will have a no problem safe time. Its a big city afterall! Highlights - great food and drinks at the hotel after walking the city, super comfortable beds that are HUGE, very cool design for shower and bathroom to maximise open-ness. Think a morgan style hotel with extra coolness. 10 out of 10 and this is now my favorite hotel of all time.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning...”
Reviews.Author: petercitrine
Reviews.Content: Chose the Raval because of comments made on this site..got good rates off tinterweb..1st time in Barcelona so pushed the boat out..made the right choice for sure... Great staff...great location (though because the surrounding area is being slowly upgraded there were a few dodgy characters around and about and along the streets leading to The Ramblas)..clean beyond clean...roof terrace a must day & night... Best bed we've ever slept in...took toiletries...didn't need to...loads provided... Shower fantastic...being on show(ish) not a problem for us...added to the fun... Returning to the streets around & about...I'm not a city person...was a bit worried before I got there...a couple of hours into the the 1st day I was fine.. For sure have your wits about you..and there shouldn't be a problem... Watching the scam artists on The Ramblas from a distance is a scream...just look at how they work..eye-opener.. Loads of Police around so felt safe... When I return to Barca to do the things we couldn't fit in...we'll definitely stay at the Barcelo Raval...thank you all on this site and thank you Barcelo Raval... Ps: If you need to use a taxi..get the price before you get in...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKiwis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! The moment you step into the lobby you know you are somewhere rather memorable. It's been uniquely decorated throughout and everything has been thought of. The staff are friendly, the rooms spacious and super clean and the beds were really comfy. We were also really impressed with the luggage security - we checked out at about 10 in the morning and left our bags with reception. Unlike many other hotels we've been to, only staff were allowed in the luggage room and we were given tickets for our bags. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas - the streets to get to it may seem a little dodgy at night time but we always felt safe. The eleventh floor terrace would be gorgeous in summer - 360 views all around Barcelona. In short, when we go back to Barcelona we will not hesitate in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with lousy security”
Reviews.Author: Syrah-Viognier
Reviews.Content: This should have been a positive review. But it won't be! To make a long story short, the hotel is fabulous, its security not so... You see, someone stole a handbag of ours at the hotel's lobby, right under the nose of the security manager who was present at the time... Part 1: The room We made the reservation through barcelonahotels.es back in late August and took advantage of the hotel's amazing opening offer that gave us a double room with 40% discount. We booked our room for seven nights in Christmas. We arrived late in the afternoon of our arrival day (a piece of advice to travelers using the Metro: although it will take you everywhere in Barcelona, it's not the best way to travel when you're carrying a lot of luggage like we did; the escalators usually go only one way and there's a lot of stairs to climb up or down). The staff was very kind and spoke very well English so we were in our room on the fourth floor within minutes. The room had a big double bed. It was the best bed we've slept on! Very big, very comfortable with very comfy cushions, pillows and a great quilt. The room itself is fairly comfortable. It's rather big, with a huge window-wall. On the room's desk, under the television set, there were many guidebooks of Barcelona, so you needn't worry about buying one: you'll find all the info you want right there. The television was a flat screen LG with satellite reception. There is no separate bathroom. The room has a beautiful shower right next to the bed. The shower's walls are semi-transparent, so you must be very intimate with your roommate if you decide to stay there. There are though other rooms that have separate bathroom. The shower is magnificent! It has a rain function that is very relaxing and a temperature regulator to keep the water at a steady temperature.
